commits.message:
DAOS-623 common: Print extracted information about memory class (#9626)

* For sanity sake, print some information about the instantiated memory
class including the base address and pool_uuid_lo.  These are used
to construct an OID from a DAOS offset.
* Print more information in umem allocation debug to better identify them

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10953 test: Detect issue with remove in unit test code (#9613)

Addresses CID: 21874, 21952
Rather than ignoring return value of remove, print an error if
it fails and return an error to the caller.
Fix an issue checkpatch saw in same code
Add an assertion for 21748. This doesn't clear coverity issue but I believe it is a
false positive with this change.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Fix a compiler warning (#9564)

dpar serial library wasn't using compiler flags.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 debug: Add some debug for umem_reserve/defer_free (#9577)

This makes these APIs consistent with umem_alloc/free

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-11053 build: Remove check for dpdk/rte_eal.h (#9588)

Having this check requires some hacky additions to extra_include_dirs
and it doesn't seem to actually affect the build.  So try removing it.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 test: Bump memcheck stage timeout to 45 minutes (#9589)

We are close to the limit for this stage, bump it up a bit to
avoid frequent intermittent failures.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 pylint: Fix some pylint warnings (#9566)

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Build static libdts instead (#9406)

I still can't explain why this caused bug with rpm installed
but this seems to address the issue.  Regardless, the server side
tests should not be linking with libdaos.so implicitly.
Additional changes:
1. No need to not build crt_launch based on mpi or use mpi environment
2. Remove CPPPATH for src/include/daos.  All headers should use
   daos/[header] anyway.

Also, a recent change caused the build to crash if a mpi compiler is
installed, change this so that it works as before and mpi is optional.

Do not setup rpath or cpppath for the mpi directory, the core daos
libraries should not need this as it's an optional component.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>
Co-authored-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 git: Fix .gitignore after name change of generated file (#9440)

_structures_from_macros_.h was inadvertently changed to
_structures_from_macros.h so update the file and remove
the obsolete entry.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

Required-githooks: true

DAOS-623 build: Move some builds around (#9381)

Removes SConscript.test
Moves dpar MPI wrapper to src/utils/wrap/mpi. If we add new wrappers, they
can go in src/utils/wrap
Moves libdts to src/tests since only files in that directory use it
Remove some redundant object builds
Moves libdaos_tests back to src/common
Adds a check for missing dependencies
Fix scons -h bug introduced in prior patch
Remove -v from go build introduced in last patch

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10849 build: Run a test with ALT_PREFIX (#9396)

Remove —deps-only and replace with —build-deps=only
Add sticky DEPS option to specify a subset of deps to build when the above option is set.
Add a test for ALT_PREFIX option, using these features to build ofi in an alternative location.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Improve the preprocessing steps (#9390)

A couple of things were causing the preprocessing step in cart
to generate _structures_from_macros.h to be slow

1. The Preprocessor builder currently doesn't support building
   multiple items in parallel so it's better to call it one file
   at a time.
2. Use Command builders for intermediate steps so they don't need
   to be repeated
3. Pick to allow W503

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10739 build: Add explicit dependencies for libraries (#9315)

Keep track of built libraries and add explicit dependencies to
library, program, test, and command builders, automatically.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Avoid calling pkg-config unnecessarily (#9302)

When there is no 'lib' or 'lib64' directory under component prefix,
the call to ParseConfig is unlikely to succeed so avoid trying it.
This removes error messages from pkg-config from the build output
and avoids unecessary invocations.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10674 build: Add UCX builder, similar to other dependencies (#9190)

* Add functions check to Component definitions (DAOS-10746) so we can ensure the installed ucx is adequate
* Like other components, USE_INSTALLED=ucx|all will use system version
* Update builds to require ucx for build.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10396 build: Patch build for SPDK (#9223)

Apply the SPDK patch to fix Fedora build (meson 0.6)
Adds subdirectory feature for patches since this particular patch
applies to a submodule but is run from spdk root.

To run git apply with optional subdir, ser can specify
=[subdir^]

Also, grab submodules before applying patches.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>
Co-authored-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Cleanup and fix some issues with the build (#9155)

Remove Glob('*.c') usage which can cause some issues
Remove extra CPPPATH entries
Move header file checks so they are in one place.
Workaround SCons Configure bug 2757 by using builder to check
headers
scons users group said using VariantDir(subdir, '.') is a bad idea so rework that a bit to set it on each SConscript call to avoid any potential
for recursion.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Add dev-build-watchers for SCons changes (#9161)

To try to prevent bugs being committed to SCons build files,
add dev-build-watchers when changes happen.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10677 test: Add a new suppression for internal MPI leak (#9173)

We started seeing a new leak inside of OpenMPI so suppress it

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Remove a debug print from build (#9141)

* fix the extension for Preprocessed files as it already
includes a .
* Fix addtional bugs in preprocessor builder. The emitter was seriously
broken.  This explains why the preprocessor targets keep getting rebuilt

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 hooks: Make the yamllint hook only run on diffs (#9099)

Also fix some comments to make it clear how a user might workaround
issues locally.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian J. Murrell <brian.murrell@intel.com>
DAOS-10465 vos: Don't set aggregation optimization flag by default (#9034)

DAOS-10465 vos: Avoid using aggregation optimization on v2.0 pool (#8953)

Explicitly enable the optimization when the GLOBAL_VERSION is >= 1.
DAOS 2.0 has no such property so the global version will be 0. This
should allow us to use a 2.0 pool even if it's been touched by 2.2

For pools that are created with 2.2, we set an new durable format version
such that this feature is always enabled. This maintains compatibility with
the old durable format up until a pool upgrade.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10494 common: Use likely in assert macro (#8921)

Also casts the expression to a uintptr_t.  Otherwise we get
compiler warnings when someone does

D_ASSERT(x)

where x is a pointer.  I tried a couple of scenarios and codegen is
identical for cast vs no cast

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10494 common: Assert macros run the condition more than once (#8873)

This can be problematic if the condition runs a function.  We noticed
this when trying to insert a patch for coverity issue 349749. That
fix is in this patch for reference.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10200 vos: Avoid setting dth in TLS across yield (#8857)

Holding the value across a yield can cause undefined behavior.
At some point, this should be fixed so we pass the dth through
parameters rather than expecting us to always get this right
inside of VOS.  Making sure we never have it set across yield
points is difficult.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 copyright: Update copyrights on changed files (#8845)


Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10227 vos: Optimize setting of aggregatable time (#8752)

Avoid setting aggregatable time when the evtree has nothing to
aggregate.  For example, if extents are disjoint, there is no
need to scan the tree, even if there is more than one extent.

Since this is also used for EC aggregation, we need to ensure we
invoke EC aggregation when there is a parity mismatch.  Without
stripe and cell size, the best we can do is set the flag any time
there is both a partial and a parity extent.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10227 vos: Fix a bug and add more bits to timestamp (#8709)

For RDB to perform 1000 txns/s, we need more bits to store
an epoch.   Use 42-bits of HLC instead of 32.  This gives us
roughly 116 years worth of epochs.

Also, don't update the epoch if it's lower than the stored
one.  This is a bug.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10227 vos: Use aggregatable filter in EC aggregation (#8701)

Optimize EC aggregation by ignoring any tree that doesn't have
an aggregatable write

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-7734 build: Wrap MPI code in unified interface (#8127)

Link daos test code with a serialized stub library to avoid direct
linkage against MPI.  Using dlopen, this stub library can
try to load an MPI enabled version of the same but otherwise,
can execute the same applications without MPI.

This simplifies our packages and allows us to ship more utilities
in packages without any MPI dependence.  In fact, only one library
depends on MPI with this change.

We could, optionally, ship just the source for this MPI enabled library,
complete with a Makefile so users could plugin their own version if
they want to use MPI with our utilities.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10227 vos: Export aggregatable time to filter callback (#8620)

If we simply export the aggregatable time, we don't need to call
into vos iterator functions to retrieve it and we can do the filter
directly in the aggregation filter callback. This will make it
simpler to use this timestamp in EC aggregation code.

Also, optimize the snapshot aggregation case to ignore trees that
have no aggregatable write after the low epoch.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 perf: Add some flexibility to daos_perf and vos_perf (#8597)

Allow user to specify a subset of objects, dkeys, akeys, or recx
as part of an update or fetch command.

This will allow us to do a little more targeted aggregation performance
testing using vos_perf and daos_perf.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Remove psm3 option from INCLUDE (#8614)

Remove an unecessary --disable-psm3 line.  It will be set by the
subsequent INCLUDE option check.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-9756 vos: Track latest aggregatable write (#8348)

Move filtering of entries to the filter callback to avoid ilog scans if entries can be
trivially skipped.

Save the upper 32-bits of the HLC (or for RDB and other entities, the lower 32-bits
of the epoch) for the last aggregatable write to the tree feats so we can filter entries
that don't need to be aggregated from the scan at container, object, dkey, and akey
level. For now, the last aggregatable write is defined as an object or key punch or
the 2nd write to a single value or array. This can be further refined for array values
in the future to only update it if there are adjacent or overlapping extents.

This allows us to easily skip unchanged entries or entries that will be noops for
aggregation.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-9756 vos: Add pre-check filter to vos iterator (#8429)

Modify vos_iterate so that it never invokes a single callback more than once.
Add a test that yields, skips, and aborts iterator and checks that no key is used in a single
callback more than once and count the total number of calls.

Add a pre-check filter enabling things such as filtering non-EC objects from EC
aggregation without checking the incarnation log.
Modify some of the callbacks for the vos iterator to enable updates to the anchor
on probe and next since objects/keys skip several entries during these operations.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-7878 vos: Partial revert of punch propagation (#8439)

From PR#7218

Do not propagate to object level as it has some performance implications
that are not acceptable.  At some point, we may need to revisit this
but for now, this is a suitable solution.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-9756 vos: Fix bug in ilog_fetch (#8410)

There is an inconsistency in the handling of -DER_INPROGRESS entries.
In all cases, the whole ilog should be parsed and the entries should
be marked such, letting the higher level parsing function handle
things. There was previously an inconsistency between the behavior
when updating status on a cached ilog and reading a new one.

Also, remove some unecessary assertions on the critical path and,
since we no longer ever return -DER_INPROGRESS from ilog_fetch,
remove a check on the critical path as well. Ultimately, this
removes a few branches from the critical path and does seem to help
performance a little in my local testing.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-9756 vos: Avoid separate allocation for removal tracking (#8376)

In first implementation of ilog tracking, we added a separate
allocation for tracking removals. Embed this information
in the, normally embedded, status array. This doesn't make
a big difference in practice but does reduce allocations on the
critical path for aggregation.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-9756 vos: Offload object/key punch aggregation to gc (#8236)

Where possible, offload the punch aggregation of object and
key subtrees to garbage collection.   If an object or key is
punched in the specified range and not visible outside of
that range, we can avoid scanning it for aggregation and just
put it in the container garbage collection heap.

Add garbage collection timer to vos_perf

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 tools: Fix the pre-commit hook for older versions of git (#8360)

Older versions of git do not handle the wildcards well.  From
copious experimentation, I discovered that the wildcard entries
must start with '*' and that all such entries need to be before
non-wildcard entries.  Otherwise, the diff command in the hook
will match every file in the repo whether modified or not.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-9920 vos: Wrong error returned on fetch (#8230)

When we detect that we have an in progress entry, we should
not return -DER_NONEXIST.  Fetch should never return -DER_NONEXIST
unless it's a conditional.  A change was added to stop_check
helper function to detect if a transaction is in progress but
didn't update the return code.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Also export the package version in the header (#8182)

daos_version.h gives users the API version of libdaos.  This may
not always match the package version, which could also be useful
to know.

Signed-off-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

reviews.body: I've added request_for_2.2 to ticket
Add gatekeeper when ready to go
Some of these changes seem to be related to a bad merge or something.  Can you please check?
Can you add a reference to the other PR for master branch?   Github will recognize it if you just give # followed by number

commits.message:
DAOS-10932 oid: Change trace to MD for oid alloc (#9549)

Change a few TRACE message to MD for debugging
OID allocation.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10996 tests: check layout_get return value (#9595)

check layout_get return value.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10435 IV: add update and sync epoch for pool IV. (#9053)

Assume these IV update process.

1. pool service start, IV prop update asynchronously.
2. set property.
3. pool IV update asynchronously.

Since 1 and 3 are asynchrnously, especially if 1 needs to
retry, then 1 might arrive later than 3 for one engine, so
adding epoch to pool IV key, and if the incoming IV update epoch
is older than the current epoch of the entry, let's ignore
the update.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10833 object: keep the same epoch for replicate rebuild (#9452)

replicate data needs to keep the same epoch during rebuild,
otherwise it will mess up its relationship with parity epoch,
and cause data corruption during rebuild.

During parity rebuild, only encode the parity if the other parity
is already encoded.

Increase container test timeout value to 450.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10525 rebuild: fix data shard rebuild epoch (#9382)

EC data shard rebuild epoch should be no higher than
the replicate data epoch on the parity shard, otherwise
parity shard might have lower epoch than its data shard,
which can cause data corruption for degraded fetch.

Add test case to verify it.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10525 pool: update dom status during reintegration. (#9194)

Only update domain status if the original status is DOWN
or DOWNOUT, i.e. partial targets reintegration may not
need change domain status.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10525 object: Use rebuild version to check parity alive (#9292)

Let's use current rebuild version (from object) to check
parity alive to avoid unnecessary failure/retry during
rebuild.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10525 pool: cleanup MAP rank init (#9183)

Remove map_ranks_class and move map_ranks_merge to
d_rank_list_range.

And DRAIN rank are still accessible until the rank
is excluded from the pool_map, so broacast RPC should
still include DRAIN ranks.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10525 object: retry for NONLEADER (#9193)

Nonleader is a temporary state during leader swich,
so let's retry for object I/O.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-9636 object: EC parity rotation (#8384)

Add dkey hash to EC leader selection process.

Cleanup client shards selection for each operation for EC
rotation and online OSA.

Remove obj_req_get_tgts(), and move each operation shards
selection into each dc_obj operation.

Cleanup client stack for different EC related shard selection process.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10679 pool: check pic_size (== -1) for pool conns IV (#9178)

-1 in pic_size is used to tell the real size of the pool
connection IV size, and no pic_conns, so checking pic_size
in pool_iv_conn_lookup().

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10525 ec: fix typo in obj_ec_recov_cb (#9191)

Initialize task list in obj_ec_recov_cb.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10521 rebuild: Only set NOT_STARTED status if map_version < 2 (#8988)

Only set DRS_NOT_STARTED if the pool map version < 2, otherwise
if there are no ongoing rebuild, let's set rebuild status as
DRS_COMPLETE.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10194 container: delete iv entry before close cont hdl (#9001)

Let's delete IV entry before container handle, which might yield,
to avoid inflight I/O might re-open/start the container through IV
at the same time.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10589 rebuild: do not update rec/obj count for leader iv notify (#9000)

Do not update rebuild rec/object cnt for leader IV notify information,
which might mess up the rebuild rec/object count.

Features: rebuild
Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10125 rebuild: add rebuild generation (#8838)

Add rebuild generation for each rebuild retry, which will
be increased whenever it needs to retry rebuild, to avoid
retry rebuild might mess with the original rebuild.

Some cleanup for rebuild complete notification.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10435 ec: set peer parity before checking (#8859)

Setting peer parity targets before checking if peer
parity is alive, otherwise it might skip the peer
parity update during EC aggregation, and cause parity
inconsistency on different parity shards.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10145 EC: recalculate EC checksum for hole processing (#8695)

Since EC multiple shards fetch might mess up the reply CSUM,
so let's recalculate the checksum during EC aggregation.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10172 rebuild: scan yield after processing objects (#8682)

rebuild scan should only yield after the current object
has been processed, since the reprobe will skip the
object, then it will not be rebuilt.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>
DAOS-10145 rebuild: only fetch csum for replicate rebuild (#8657)
DAOS-10180 rebuild: cancel rebuild if it is not PS leader (#8581)

DAOS-9636 object: catch all retry error for update and punch ops (#8538)

If retry error is caught before obj_comp_cb() callback is
registered, even though obj_comp_cb() is executed, but the
following tse_task_complete() will cancel the retry callback.

So cleanup the tx convert process to catch all retry failure
correctly.

Add test case to verify it.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-9335 pool: stop container before abort ec_eqh ult (#8572)

Stop container before abort ec_eqh ULT, to avoid container
EC aggregation ULT to access ec_eqh after abort ec_eqh ULT.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10172 rebuild: wait dtx resync globally (#8554)

Let's wait for dtx resync to finish on all engines, then
start rebuild, to make sure rebuild will not miss any
un-commit data during rebuild/reintegration.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10147 EC: clear EC stripe list if EC aggregation is aborted (#8500)

clear EC stripe list if EC aggregation is aborted, since post_cb
might be skipped.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-9636 EC: various fixes about EC (#8506)

1. Various fixes for EC multiple shards enumeration.

2. Check efi_stripe_sgls, instead of efi_stripe_lists, which will
not be set for single value.

3. Remove unnecessary assert in obj_ec_recov_stripe(), since fail_info
list might be shared by multiple recover tasks, so one recov ent list
may not exist in one IOD.

4. Remove unnecessary invalid nr check for multiple shards enumeration.

5. Reset kd_key_len to 0 for enumeration, since it may return the
required size for KEY2BIG case.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-9636 object: separate object and dtx leader selection (#8419)

Spearate object and dtx leader selection

1. object choose the leader based on the layout and dkey_hash, which
EC parity rotation will use to choose the leader.

2. DTX choose the selection based on mbs.

And also move leader selection from pl_map.c to object and dtx.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-10125 rebuild: add rebuild IV debug info (#8469)

Add some rebuild IV debug information.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-9756 object: add ec_update timestamp (#8440)

Add ec_update timestamp for each EC modify IO, and
do EC aggregation will only be executed only if
there is EC object modification.

This is only for 2.0 release to resolve EC aggregate
performance issue temporarily.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>
DAOS-10044 object: Fix recovery list for EC recovery (#8379)

DAOS-9793 placement: Do not add extending shards for readonly open (#8044)

Since extending shards are only needed for update, so do not need
add extending shards for readonly open, for example migration enum
or fetch.

Do not need check DOWN status for extending shards. Then extra shards
might change their location due to co-location, so it also needs to
update pl map test.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-9635 object: multiple shards enumeration fix (#7991)

The patch fix the enumeration from multiple data shards,
for example degrade enumeration, or parity rotation,

1. Each shard will prepare KDS/SGL/RECX buffer invidually,
and attached to the anchor.

2. After each shard get the enumeration buffer, it
needs to sort these dkey/recxs from all shards altogether
by its order inside the VOS, so to avoid duplicate/missing
keys for enumeration.

3. Then these merged/sorted keys/recxs are dumped to
the user kds/sgl/recx, and the leftover will be left in
the merged list, which will be retrieved in the following
enumeration.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-9317 rsvc: ingore ALREADY failure (#7685)

Ignore already failure for ds_rsvc_dist_start(), because
restart svc rank might already start rsvc service.

When re-adding an old RDB replica, we may observe that the first
InstallSnapshot to this replica fails with -DER_MISC. This is due to a
bug in rdb_raft_cb_recv_installsnapshot_resp, which doesn't check if the
whole snapshot is complete in addition to if the chunk is successfully
stored.

Signed-off-by: Di Wang <di.wang@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>

DAOS-11007 cart: Convert return codes from hg to daos on rpc completion. (#9713)

Catch another case where a hg return code is being passed as DER_HG
rather than converting to a daos error code where possible.

This allows the stack to identify non-recoverable failures better
and to correctly abort or handle errors rather than spinning.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-8722 dfuse: Add timeouts to readdir caching. (#9610)

Rather than let the kernel cache readdir data forever keep
track of access times and honour the duration settings for
caching.

Fix a bug where dentry-time and data-cache both needed to
be enabled for readdir caching, it's not entirely based
on dentry-time.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-11034 dfuse: Back off to kernel from IL on failed read. (#9562)

When a simple read fails in the interception library for any
reason then disable I/O for that file and retry through the
kernel.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-11007 cart: Convert from mercury to daos error codes. (#9569)

*Rather than using -DER_HG in a lot of places call the crt_hgret_2_der()
function which will translate some known error codes and use -DER_HG
for others.  This means the upper layers of the stack should see
-DER_HG in a lot less cases, and get more meaningful errors in others.
* Tidy up the header file by remove inline functions from header
which were only called from one file.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 debug: Correct some debug lines using DF_UIOD. (#9511)

Add spaces or : so the output renders correctly.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-7821 test: Fix style errors with datamover tests. (#9570)

Resolve cosmetic python and yaml warnings.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-7821 gha: Add code to report Jira status into GitHub. (#9628)

Add a GitHub action to parse Jira ticket information for a PR and update the PR
metadata to keep it in sync with Jira. Add a comment to the PR which will be edited
to keep it up-to-date, and report the ticket description and status as well as adding
a link.

Warn on several issues around malformed PR titles (which become part of the commit
message when landed) and if work is happening on tickets which are not marked
as In Progress or In Review.

Set labels for 2.2 and 2.4 release tickets, as well as anything that should be treated
as a priority.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10739 dfuse: Increase timeouts for daos_build test. (#9389)

Change timeouts and settings for daos_build test so that it works
again. A recent change in VM configuration increased the runtime
so this test was failing and as a result the test got disabled.
Increase the timeouts so the test passes again, and move the test
back to daily running.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-11001 dfuse: Remove unused test code. (#9607)

This code was written for IOF but disabled in that tree and
copied over to daos, it has not been compiled for at least
five years.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Small changes to the cart build. (#9473)

Do not add src/cart to includes, and change how headers are loaded.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

Revert DAOS-10365 dfuse: Allow dfuse caching of attributes. (#8777) (#9526)

This reverts commit b4b2bc08b818ca081741b1017d3f06b5c0f7d244.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10873 cq: Fix the date githook on OS X. (#9466)

Use the correct sed options, and do not run the hook on merge
commits.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-7821 cq: Update daos_pylint handling of fake_scons. (#9460)

Handle fake_scons as it's own class with specific requirments.
This means it's tested more strictly, and we can disable specific
checks for it.
Update daos_pylint to accept directories on the command line.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-6540 dfuse: Add a ioctl to fetch the dfuse user. (#9491)

Add an ioctl so that client can identify the uid/gid of the
dfuse process.  This will be used by the interception library
and when creating daos containers with the --path option.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 python: Do not use #! for python files. (#9494)

Remove /usr/bin/python from lots of places were it's not
required.  If needed then the file should have execute
permissions, and the line should read /usr/bin/env python3
so this code was both not used and incorrect.

Do not touch the ftest code as there are too many files
incorrect there for me to edit manually.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 docker: Remove venv hack on el7. (#9513)

Do not delete the venv as part of the docker script so that's it's available
to builds.  Use venv on el7 to move it in sync with other distros.
Pass PATH and venv settings to sudo for fault injection tests.

This brings all distros in sync with how the manage packages and we no
longer have a special case for dockerfiles which are used by Jenkins builds.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10365 dfuse: Allow dfuse caching of attributes. (#8777)

Use cached values for inodes when required.
When the kernel is using writeback cache then it can query inode
metadata before the timeout has expired and this costs every time
a file is opened.  To handle this keep a record of when the inode
was last reported to the kernel and for requests before the
timeout then reply with the cached data, but use a shorter timeout.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 cq: Remove legacy D_FREE_PTR macro. (#9464)

We moved away from using this macro several years ago so no new
code has used it for some time, remove all remaining calls and the
macro itself.  It has been an alias for D_FREE since it was created.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10665 test: Call container create --path with only file component.

Add a test to call container create --path but not passing
a directory.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman ashley.m.pittman@intel.com

DAOS-623 build: Update el 9 dockerfile for new option. (#9475)

A conflict between two PRs meant that the el9 dockerfile was
added using a option just as it was renamed to something else.
Update the dockerfile to the new name.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-7821 pylint: Improve spellings checking and warn on errors. (#9400)

Ignore spelling warnings in certain cases, if they look like code, are quoted or
likely help text or command options rather than actual errors.
When using GitHub actions report failure back into the job.
Enforce spellcheck for non-ftest code.
Fix a number of classes of flake error, and enable checking for them.
Correct a number of spelling errors.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-7821 cq: Improve pylint coverage and fix issues. (#9385)

Automatically enable spellings checks using one config file.
Resolve many errors in src/tests/ftest/util/*.py
Use a temporary file when wrapping scons files.
Fix a bug with CGO handling.
Resolve some spelling and flake warnings.
Flush file before calling pylint.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-8722 dfuse: Document and log readdir kernel support. (#9318)

Set the flag to allow the kernel to cache readdir requests,
update the documentation and version/log output to make it
clear if this feature is compiled in or not.

DAOS-623 build: Update clang-format settings. (#9007)

Change Alignment to be closer to our established code.
Change spaces to tabs to avoid a clang bug.
Enable clang-format githook if clang-format 14.0.5 or greater is detected

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-7652 dfuse: Allow True/False for dfuse cache settings. (#9370)

Allow True/False as well as on/off and ignore case for dfuse
cache attributes.
Ensure all attribute settings are logged.
Correct an error when an invalid setting was used for direct-io-disable.
Only set container attributes once.

This makes it more user friendly, as well as allowing Python True/False
values to be set without translating into on/off.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10383 dfuse: Add logging to enospace test. (#9266)

Add logging to help diagnose an intermittent failure.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-6540 dfuse: Use correct uid/gid bits when creating files. (#9171)

Pass in the required uid/gid to dfs when creating either files
or directories rather than having dfs call getuid().

This allows groups to work properly in dfuse, and will also
support multi-user dfuse when enabled.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10354 dfuse: Enable dfuse-daos-build test elements. (#8978)

Enable more versions of the dfuse-daos-build test and move from daily to weekly.
Working through the remaining issues with this test I realised it works when running
the daos build in serial but not parallel so I've changed the test to do that and we'll
work on resolving missing dependencies with the scons build seperately.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 cq: Add a githook for running flake on build code. (#9157)

Create a flake8 config file which disables checks that do not
work well with SCons files, and extend the flake githook
to check build code modified in a PR.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10396 build: Remove restriction on version of meson. (#9287)

We now patch spdk to fix the build issue so remove the restiction
on the meson version.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-7821 ci: Add a pylint job to github actions. (#8799)

Add new pylint testing to github actions which runs across the whole tree on every PR. Fixes all issues in the Build
code other than f-string and all Errors in all python code, it'll allow us to configure Github to not allow landings of
PRs that contain regressions. Still to do is work on suppressing or resolving many spelling errors, and looking at
warnings in the non-build python code.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DCO-10410 build: Change how dnf repos are managed. (#9142)

The epel-release package exists in core CentOS, but also in
epel itself, so in order to get it up-to-date you need on a
new system you need to install the pacakge, then upgrade it
to get the newer epel version.  Have the dockerfiles action
this second install directly after the first.

Remove the makecache from REPOs sections of the dockerfiles
This ties in with other steps that delete any temporary and
cache files between RUN commands which causes the resulting
images to be smaller and avoids a extra download during the
build.

Together these avoid a bug we were seeing in docker/dnf for
cases where REPO was used, a combination of the cache files
and dnf updating epel-release meant that dnf was re-loading
the packages metatdata and causing a problem with overlayfs
where opening the same file RO and then RW would cause both
file descriptors to give differing version of the contents.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-7821 gha: Update distros to latest versions. (#9172)

Drop CentOS 7 build from GitHub action.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Remove CentOS 7 stages (#9269)

Remove stages to build and test CentOS 7 on rpms.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Tidy up base_env usage and mpi modules. (#8637)

Do not add all the src dirs to base_env, add them as needed.
Create a common base_env_mpi env.

This has several benefits, it means that base_env can be
used as a basic env with no daos specific options set, yet
whilst having all the required compiler flags etc.
Mpicc is only setup once, leading to faster build times and
cleaner/shorter output.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10029 test: Use python3 for list_tests. (#8911)

Now the builders have python3 installed use it for list tests.
This means that launch.py and the tests themselves can use
python3 features and the codebase should not depend on python2
any longer.

Fix some linting errors in launch.py

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 test: Update json format for NLT. (#9127)

A recent change to the daos command changed the case for
some json entries.  Update NLT to expect the new names.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Add systemd as a dependency on el8. (#9124)

A recent upstream change means this isn't being installed
by default and without it the permissions on /tmp are
incorrect so docker builds fail.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>
DAOS-6540 dfuse: Add chgrp support to dfuse. (#9107)

DAOS-10354 dfuse: Check thread id in interception library destructor. (#9103)

Only run the destructor if run in the same thread id as the constructor.
some programs, at least sh, run lightweight threads so can end up
calling the destructor more times than the constructor, so to avoid
deadlocks save the tid in the constructor and only run the destructor
if it matches.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Use pip to install deps on Ubuntu. (#8816)

Install python dependencies rather than OS ones so we get to
control the versions used.

This allows daos to build in Docker under ubuntu:22.04 as it avoids
the the meson/spdk build issue.

Resolve issues with the utils/scripts/ files and update the documentation on their use.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10505 dfuse: Remove user-space readahead feature entirely. (#8929)

This is done by the kernel and it's use in userspace doesn't help
and causes potential conflicts.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-6864 build: Declare libdaos_common as dependency in scons. (#9017)

Add libdaos_common as an explict Requires in scons so that it
knows not to build targets that depend on it until it's ready.
This avoids occasional compile errors, particuarly when building
in parallel over dfuse which changes the filesystem performance.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-8719 dfuse: Run the daos_build test in different configurations. (#8789)

Add a mux and have the test run across a matrix of settings.
Use python venv for tools, and remove from rpm deps.
Have build pass on env vars needed to build.
Decrease timeout to reduce runtime.
Do not log to stderr from IL as this breaks git.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10488 test: Add dfuse unit test code and call it from ftest. (#7286)


Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10490 build: Use major-minor python versions when installing pydaos. (#8867)

Some setups require the use of the minor version number when installing
so use this rather than just python3

Remove redundant code from the build step.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10356 dfuse: Disable dfuse metadata caching when using IL. (#8760)

Track when the IL has opened file handles and invalidate all kernel
metadata when in use.  Track the ioctl calls and use atomics to
track the number of calls per open file, and the number of files
per inode, when returning inode metadata check the il-in-use count.

This should mean that when the IL is in use, all metadata requests
will go to the servers, so avoids a situation where a file is opened,
the IL writes data to it then the kernel will continue to return
stale size data.

Add checks in forget that the IL and open file count are at zero.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10355 dfuse: Add interception for ftruncate. (#8771)

Add interception for ftruncate.  This does not change the file
position so is reasonably easy.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-9907 yaml: Update yamllint configuration to be more user-friendly. (#8774)

Rename the rc file so it can be over-ridden locally.
Disable truthy for keys and remove suppressions.
Change github action to work on commit, not merge so lines are reported
correctly.
Fix issue in docs.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10353 dfuse: Use 64 bit types for storing inode in IL. (#8772)

When intercepting fstat the interception library was storing
the inode in a 32 bit variable which would lead to incorrect
values being reported to the user.  Ensure the correct types
are used.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-9907 yaml: Add yamllint to github actions and fix issues. (#8559)

* DAOS-7821 yaml: Add yamllint to github actions and fix issues.

Add a github actions job to check for yaml formatting.
Write a yamllint config file to disable some checks for ftest
Fix all serious errors and all errors outside ftest.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Allow use of python venv for scons. (#8590)

Setup the EL8 docker build to use venv and latest versions
of python packages rather than packaged versions.
Update build scipts to pass python venv settings onto the deps
build.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-7821 pydaos: Improve setup.py and add test to GHA. (#8556)

Fix style errors in pydaos install script and add it to
automatic testing.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-7821 flake: Add flake8 config file and resolve some warnings. (#8460)

Resolve all instances of some classes of warnings and enable these
in GHA.
Write a config file for local use.
Add a script as a basis for a git-hook to run checks pre-commit.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-10184 test: Add a test for size of dfs symlink. (#8389)

Fix an issue where the initial size of symbolic links and directories is reported wrongly by dfs, which when used by dfuse means the incorrect value can be saved into the kernel cache.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 build: Improve site_scons handling of build commands (#8299)

Move from string to list to simplify call to subprocess commands

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-9934 test: Suppress any error from go. (#8390)

Add memcheck suppressions to silence any go warnings based on
filename.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-9132 test: Update memcheck suppressions (#8367)

Suppress all memcheck failures observed on EL 8 testing.
Add generic runtime.* suppressions, and remove less specific ones.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-9790 build: Improve DAOS_KEEP_BUILD option in docker (#8173)

This isn't required as DAOS_KEEP_SRC is used instead.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-7821 build: Use --chown option in dockerfiles. (#8223)

This speeds up the build and reduces space requirments as
it removes a layer and a recursive chown on files copied
into the image.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-8937 dfuse: Fix issues in building on dfuse (#6319)

Run a build of DAOS on a dfuse projection and fix issues.

Downgrade lots of log messages from INFO to DEBUG.
Add openat() to interception library.
Fix return code for a number of ioctl calls.
Improve NLT to re-use container for launch mode, and have it
print settings required to use IL.

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

reviews.body: I've got https://github.com/daos-stack/daos/pull/9671 which is some improvements to this but I was thinking to sit on it a week to include any other issues that cropped up.  Possibly we should squash the two and land it?

There was something odd I had to do to python in docker on el7 to have it load the python libs correctly, https://github.com/daos-stack/daos/blob/master/utils/docker/Dockerfile.centos.7#L104-L110 is the el7 hack but the rest of the dockerfiles look like https://github.com/daos-stack/daos/blob/master/utils/docker/Dockerfile.el.8#L109-L119
When https://github.com/daos-stack/daos/pull/9513 has landed you can remove all the packaging changes from this PR.

commits.message:
DAOS-10595 build: Update SPDK to v22.01.1 (#9063)

Update DAOS source build SPDK version and patches in utils/build.config.
Update SPDK pinned version requirements in utils/rpms/daos.spec.
Resolve API breakages resulting from SPDK version change.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9876 control: Add multiple SCM namespaces success unit test case (#9450)

Add unit test case for successful creation of multiple SCM namespaces per socket.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-11031 control: Clean hugepages on engine startup (#9625)

The previous approach to cleanup hugepages created by SPDK running in
engine process was to remove in a callback triggered on engine exit.
The criteria for hugepage file removal was that file owner matched the
running user UID and the PID encoded in the filename matched that of the
exited engine process.

This approach will not always remove all hugepages created by DAOS
processes, for example in the case where daos_server is sent SIGKILL or
when different users execute daos_server.

A more aggressive approach is implemented in this PR whereby, on
completion of engine storage format, a callback is triggered which removes
all hugepages created by SPDK that belong to a no-longer-active process
(identified by PID encoded in the filename).

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10820 control: Set system name in set engine log masks RPC (#9471)

Set system name in RPC message when setting engine log masks to avoid
interoperability check failures.

Add ftest to sanity check that the dmg server set-logmasks returns with
success to avoid regressions.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10892 control: Add backward compatibility for enable_vmd param (#9531)

Add backward compatibility for enable_vmd server config parameter

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10473 control: Do not require IOMMU for emulated NVMe (#9272)

Apply the following NVMe emulation related changes:
- If AIO is being used for NVMe emulation, don't require IOMMU and/or
VFIO to be enabled.
- Disallow the use of emulated and non-emulated NVMe in the same engine
config.
- Disable VMD if NVMe emulation is being used.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10132 doc: Update disable_vfio usage in admin guide (#9419)

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10132 doc: Describe disable_vfio usage in admin guide (#9249)

Include information on setting option when using daos_server storage
prepare as well as setting the parameter in the server config file.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10085 doc: Add syslog delivery failure to troubleshooting (#9220)

Describe the daos_server error printed when no syslog daemon is
configured and how to resolve it in the troubleshooting guide.

Also fixes a formatting issue in an error message.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10012 control: Correct yaml path printed when missing (#9209)

Currently if no path is specified in commandline when daos_server is
run and the default path is empty, no path is passed to LoadConfig()
and SetPath() attempts to resolve a new adjacent path. This is confusing
as it will list the derived path as missing rather than the default path.

Pass the default path directly to LoadConfig() to avoid this confusion.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10660 control: Remove duplicate rank results after system fanout (#9204)

There are situations where multiple results for the same rank maybe
received after a distributed system fanout request e.g. during
dmg system stop command execution.

Work-around this issue by removing duplicate results for a single rank
after the fanout results have been collected. Log an error if the
duplicate results do not have identical content.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10603 control: Add disable_hugepages server config file parameter (#9207)

Replace setting nr_hugepages: -1 with an explicit disable_hugepages: true
directive to improve clarity of intent.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9811 control: Add server config options for hardware acceleration (#8854)

Introduce user-settable server config file parameters for hardware
acceleration options. Provide plumbing to expose parameters in BIO
module by passing through NVME JSON file used to init engine storage.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10456 control: Enable VMD by default (#8933)

Currently VMD has to be manually enabled by setting enable_vmd: true in
server config file, the downside is that on VMD enabled systems storage
scan will fail if not manually enabled. This also relates to the use case
of DAOS RPM installation on a VMD-enabled system, where discovery mode
will fail with a blank server config file (default on first install)
until the user manually creates a server config file with enable_vmd: true
in it. Enable by default to avoid this issue.

Features: control

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10132 control: Validate IOMMU is on during daos_server storage prepare (#8914)

Make behaviour consistent between NVMe storage prepare in daemon and
stand-alone daos_server commands. IOMMU has to be enabled if the target
user is not root. VFIO can only be disabled if running as root (SPDK
userspace driver falls back to UIO if available).

Features: control

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10581 doc: Update example server config files (#8996)

Stop using legacy storage style and show correct usage of nr_hugepages.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10580 control: Fix dmg storage query usage output with dual-engines (#8945)

dmg storage query usage is only reporting half the expected NVMe usage
values in a dual engine setup.

The last engine's scan response will overwrite valid stats written by
previous engine because the bdev cache contains all engine's controllers.

Fix by filtering cache to include only controllers configured on engine.

Features: control

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10538 control: Remove inner RPC timeouts for system commands (#8936)

To avoid timeouts on high-capacity storage installations, remove inner
timeouts intended to provide detail on command activity and instead
rely on lower granularity higher level RPC timeouts.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10450 control: Always set engine NUMA node on exec (#8827)

Previous behavior is that pinned_numa_node is not always passed when
executing engine which causes engine to default to NUMA-0.

In the case where server config does not specify pinned_numa_node and
control plane derives NUMA node to be 1 (e.g. from fabric_iface "ib1"
affinity), hugepages will be allocated on NUMA-1 but engine will try to
allocate DMA buffer from NUMA-0 and fail.

Correct behavior by passing pinned_numa_node commandline parameter when
starting engine unless single engine is on NUMA-0 or first_core is set,
in which case we want to avoid passing pinned_numa_node so that the
legacy core allocation algorithm is activated in the engine. Verify that
first_core and pinned_numa_node parameters are never be set together in
server config file engine section.

Co-authored-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10174 control: Reduce duration of NVMe storage format (#8603)

To reduce duration of dmg storage format command, which wipes NVMe
namespaces, use the async version of spdk_nvme_detach API which batches
detach tasks and performs them together when poll is called at a later time.
Format operations with 16TB NVMe SSDs previously took ~14s per SSD and
should now take ~15s per engine regardless of the number of SSDs.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10495 control: Remove inner RPC timeouts for system commands (#8875)

To avoid timeouts on high-capacity storage installations, remove inner
timeouts intended to provide detail on command activity and instead
rely on lower granularity higher level RPC timeouts.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10502 control: Enable discovery mode by skipping wait for fabric check (#8884)

When no fabric interfaces have been specified in config, for example in
discovery mode, skip the wait for fabric check so bringup can continue
without no fabric interfaces requested error.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10489 doc: Correct default log mask level (#8865)

Default applied if unset is INFO, correct comment and list of options.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10259 build: Add SPDK patch to fix bug with VMD init on specific drives (#8664)

Patches added in source build for the following SPDK fix:
    https://review.spdk.io/gerrit/c/spdk/spdk/+/12208

Solves DAOS-10259 where SPDK is failing in spdk_vmd_init() when
scanning from the control plane on start-up.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9812 build: Add patch to reduce device rebinding times with VMD (#8625)

Add patch which reduces time taken to rebind devices from kernel to
userspace drivers when VMD is enabled.

  * Call SPDK setup script with DRIVER_OVERRIDE=none first before calling
    with VMD endpoints specified in the allow list.
  * Retain previous non-VMD behaviour where reset is called before binding
    NVMe SSDs to userspace drivers.
  * Allow NVMe SSDs to remain bound to kernel device driver whilst VMD is
    enabled if addresses are added to bdev_exclude in server config file.
  * Prepare should fall back to non-VMD operation if no VMD endpoints can
    be prepared and enable_vmd is true in the server config file.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9876 control: Add option to create multiple PMem namespaces per socket (#8546)

Revamp SCM storage backend as a basis for implementing various changes
including handling the situation where PMem has been configured in
AppDirect non-interleaved mode (#8528) and adding
(-S N|--scm-namespaces-per-socket N) option to daos_server storage prepare
subcommand (where N can take value of 1-8) to enable creation of multiple
PMem namespaces per socket (#8518).

For example, on a typical dual-socket platform, the command:
daos_server storage prepare -s -S 2
Will generate the following PMem block devices:
/dev/pmem0 /dev/pmem0.1 /dev/pmem1 /dev/pmem1.1

Other changes:
  * Separate prep command logic as precursor to splitting
    daos_server storage prepare into
    daos_server storage (prep-scm|prep-nvme) subcommands in a follow-up
    PR.
  * Improve unit testing by applying appropriate mocking to avoid leaking
    calls into other packages.
  * Improve unit test coverage: server/storage/scm 75.8-81.2%,
    cmd/daos_server 47.9-51.3%, lib/ipmctl 10.3-56.7%.
  * Provide more informative description of PMem changes made during
    command calls.
  * Provide relevant faults on abnormal situations including resolution
    suggestions.
  * Apply libipmctl major version check and ensure support for v2 & v3.
  * Update admin guide deployment section to document new -S option.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-8046 pool: Reduce sleep durations on retry (#8624)

Reduce duration of sleep in the case of non-leader request from 1000 to
250 milliseconds and remove sleep in the case of pool map resize.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-7080 control: Deprecate format reformat option (#8622)

Remove dmg storage format --reformat as it's been replaced by --force.
Replace already-formatted terminology with filesystem signature found.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9972 build: Fix SPDK failure on VMD init after reboot (#8438)

SPDK operation not permitted failure is related to not clearing VMD
config registers after loading by kernel drive on boot. Fix by applying
SPDK patches in build.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10152 control: Remove sudo from SPDK setup script (#8489)

Script is run by daos_admin in privileged execution mode so sudo
is unnecessary.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-6955 control: add new transport id in engine nvme config (#8027)

When a device is hot inserted, a new transport ID (that will not be
present in the existing engine configuration) could be assigned to the
new device. This new transport ID should be added to be engine
configuration to enable it to be used after restart.

dmg storage nvme-add-device

The new command takes pci address and engine rank and adds SSD transport
address to the engine's SPDK JSON config file /mnt/daosX/daos_nvme.conf
so that when daos_engine is restarted, the newly added SSD can be used
by the engine.

The command should be issued to a single host (-l option) and should
fail if there are multiple hosts in hostlist.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9849 control: Correct NVMe count in DMG storage format summary (… (#8380)

On platforms with multiple NVMe namespaces per controller, multiple
device format results are being registered for a single controller
causing incorrect number of NVMe devices to be reported in command
output. The cause is that when creating a result for each namespace
wipe operation, only the first result would contain the controller
address meaning that results for both an empty address and the
controllers address are returned. These results are subsequently
interpreted as two device responses.

Changes in this PR:
  * Fix by adding controller address to each namespace wipe result.
  * Also fix device count in situation where NVMe format is skipped.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9105 control: Generate VMD-enabled server configs with DMG (#8222) (#8382)

Update control API to enable dmg config generate to work with
VMD-enabled storage servers. The cmd output YAML should contain
bdev_list of discovered (NUMA locality aligned) VMD endpoint addresses
and have verified that the number of VMD endpoints and total number of
backing NVMe SSDs behind the endpoints are both equal for each engine.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-XXX test: reset nvme bindings after tests (#8363)

In order for --nvme=auto:Optane to work with VMD enabled when running
manually, the NVMe devices should be rebound back to the kernel driver in
cleanup.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9782 control: Resolve some interop issues in DMG (#8242) (#8381)

Address two incompatibility issues seen when running DAOS 2.1 dmg
against and DAOS 2.0 daos_server.

Fix nil pointer dereference on dmg storage scan by changing
HugePageInfo reference to concrete field type (DAOS-9943)
Fix invalid NVMe device state error on dmg storage query list-devices
by removing error check and instead adding an UNKNOWN state for
invalid strings e.g. empty which covers the zero value for the smd
info state field.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-10014 control: Disable HP when running NLT and VMD workaround (#8334)

Set nr_hugepages to -1 in NLT tests and avoid NVMe scan in setup if
hugepages are disabled.

Remove unnecessary NVMe storage prepare in ftest setup.

Fail service start-up if initial scan errors (8335) to workaround VMD
cluster failure on degraded test.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9105 control: Generate VMD-enabled server configs with DMG (#8222)

Update control API to enable dmg config generate to work with
VMD-enabled storage servers. The cmd output YAML should contain
bdev_list of discovered (NUMA locality aligned) VMD endpoint addresses
and have verified that the number of VMD endpoints and total number of
backing NVMe SSDs behind the endpoints are both equal for each engine.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9782 control: Resolve some interop issues in DMG (#8242)

Address two incompatibility issues seen when running DAOS 2.1 dmg
against and DAOS 2.0 daos_server.

Fix nil pointer dereference on dmg storage scan by changing
HugePageInfo reference to concrete field type (DAOS-9943)
Fix invalid NVMe device state error on dmg storage query list-devices
by removing error check and instead adding an UNKNOWN state for
invalid strings e.g. empty which covers the zero value for the smd
info state field.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9849 control: Correct NVMe count in DMG storage format summary (#8234)

On platforms with multiple NVMe namespaces per controller, multiple
device format results are being registered for a single controller
causing incorrect number of NVMe devices to be reported in command
output. The cause is that when creating a result for each namespace
wipe operation, only the first result would contain the controller
address meaning that results for both an empty address and the
controllers address are returned. These results are subsequently
interpreted as two device responses.

Changes in this PR:
  * Fix by adding controller address to each namespace wipe result.
  * Also fix device count in situation where NVMe format is skipped.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9894 control: Fix fault package namespace (#8259)

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

DAOS-9894 control: Pass mem_size to engine when using emulated NVMe (#8148)

When scanning storage during daos_server start-up, AIO devices in bdev
storage tiers should be considered valid so that hugepage assignments
can be allocated and verified as normal, otherwise the engine process
will assume that DMA buffer memory requirements have not been met and
subsequently fail.

Signed-off-by: Tom Nabarro <tom.nabarro@intel.com>

reviews.body:
PR title and description need fixing. Go changes approved in principle.

I realise this is a port but I have a concern regarding the fact that the change makes the number of columns in the output this command variable. The variability is based on whether there has been an upgrade to the pool format, this will make people complain as there is an implicit expectation that the number of columns doesn't change over different invocations of the same command. We have had complaints about this in the past.

Given its a port we probably don't want to block on it but IMO the issue should be addressed to avoid inconveniencing users. @mjmac thoughts?

Aside from my preferences about the static columns, code looks alright to me. @wangshilong just for housekeeping purposes you should try to run the go linters on your code and fix all warnings/errors before you commit, I use golangci-lint for example but most IDEs can be configured to do it on save. Not all of us do it all of the time but it's good practice.

commits.message:
DAOS-11006 obj: fix coverity issues (#9579)

DAOS-10943 src/placement/tests/pl_bench.c
DAOS-10971 src/placement/tests/place_obj_common.c
DAOS-10955 src/placement/tests/jump_map_place_obj.c

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-10655 obj: fix possible dead loop for degraded fetch again (#9504)

1. Fix a problem when reply orwo->orw_epoch
   When the sc_ec_agg_eph_boundry moved ahead, should reply that epoch to
   client rather than original fetch epoch, so client can take that higher
   epoch to fetch again, rather than use the original epoch that may cause
   dead loop.
2. Fix a bug in ds_obj_ec_rep_handler
   the vos_obj_array_remove() is used to remove the parity ext, but it
   used incorrect epoch range that possibly cause parity epoch mismatch
   on different parity shards. That also possible cause dead loop.

And a few other small refines.

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-11029 tse/dfs: bug fix in tse or dfs about task (#9551)

1. fix a tse bug of dep task check in tse_task_complete_callback
   In tse_task_complete_callback() it checks if new dep task added in
   task's completion callback, by check dtp_dep_cnt. But a problem
   is the dep task possibly be scheduled/executed immediately and be
   completed even before checking parent task' dtp_dep_cnt, that
   could cause parent task be completed 2 times.
   This patch fixes it by adding generation of parent task.
2. take extra refcount in tse_task_complete_callback
3. fix a bug in dfs adjust_array_size_cb()
   original code possibly create+schedule multiple dep tasks in
   adjust_array_size_cb(), that may cause firstly scheduled dep task
   complete immediately and then complete parent task, but still
   possible add more other dep tasks cause trouble in race condition.
   This patch fixes it by add dep tasks to task list and schedule/abort
   them all together.
   got some hints form Zhao Zhen <zp_8483@163.com> when debug it.

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-10215 container: handle DAOS_PROP_CO_REDUN_LVL cont property (#9259)

Handle DAOS_PROP_CO_REDUN_LVL cont property, which can be set as
DAOS_PROP_CO_REDUN_RANK/DAOS_PROP_CO_REDUN_NODE.
With related changes in placement, container RF check, and property
handling.
Change "struct daos_obj_md" to add md_fdom_lvl parameter.
Added a test case to verify it.

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-10831 obj: Fix a bug in EC degraded fetch's data recovery (#9384)

It is possible that different shard fetches go to different parity
shards, they got recov_lists with different parity epoch in the case
vos aggregation happens asynchronously on different parity shards
that may merge adjacent parity exts to lower epoch.
In obj_ec_stripe_list_add() for that case can take higher epoch for
data recovery.

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-10806 test: fix a bug for setting reclaim policy (#9307)

set_pool_reclaim_strategy() does not work as DAOS_PROP_PO_RECLAIM is a
pool property rather than user attribute, so daos_pool_set_attr will not
work.
And if the test case need to compare pool space usage better to generate
separate pool rather than reuse the shared pool.

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-10829 pool: fix a bug of pmap_fail_node not inited/zeroed (#9331)

in pool_map_rf_verify() the pmap_fail_node not comopletly inited/zeroed, that
possibly cause problem as the memory in stack may with non-zero data
(pf_down/pf_new_fail possibly is 1 in extreme case).

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-9888 obj: add support of EC conditional fetch (#8958)

Add support of EC conditional fetch -
split to multiple sub-tasks for cond_akey fetch with multiple akeys
Add related UT cases.

A few bug fixes -
skip fetch/update in akey_fetch()/akey_update() for NULL recxs which is
possible when fetch multiple IODs and recxs only valid on partial shard.
fix a bug in shard_auxi_task_cb() that may use incorrect task pointer.

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-7133 tse: refine task re-init checking (#9202)

Original code using dtp_completing flag for task re-init check -
1. first set dtp_completing == 1 and call task completion CB,
2. inside task completion CB if it calls re-init then will zero the flag,
3. check dtp_completing flag if it is zero then the task was re-inited

But a problem is once the task re-inited in step2, it possibly get
executing and complete (which will set the dtp_completing flag)
immediately even before step 3.
Previously we added a lock dsp_comp_lock to avoid that but did not
resolve some cases' problem, and the lock is bad as it actually
serialized all tasks' completion callbacks' executing.

This patch refines that by adding an ATOMIC generation to the task,
and removes the dsp_comp_lock.

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-10411 obj: obj_query_key only needs to use one recx (#9146)

After PR7845 only need to pass on recx for query_recx(), this
patch cleanup server-side code.

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

OS-10342 test: remove "-c" option for hard_rebuild (#8906)

the collective option is not really needed.

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-10342 test: refine hard_rebuild.py/yaml (#8743)

1) in hard_rebuild.py, remove the first time ior_read_dataset() calling,
   as it will zero the stoneWallingStatusFile's content and fail
   the 2nd ior_read_dataset.
2) hard_rebuild.yaml, add "-c" (collective) flag for ior write to avoid
   generate holes (see ior code WriteOrRead() in ior.c, hitStonewall
   related code).

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-8640 obj: bug fixes in EC degraded update, key query and aggregation (#8535)

1) fix a bug in EC degraded update
For EC (K+1) obj partial update, it will update to one data shard and
replicate to one parity shard. When that data shard failed, the degraded
update will send to the leader parity shard.
The code of ds_obj_rw_handler() -> obj_gen_dtx_mbs() will change the
tgt_cnt to zero, then will not call obj_ec_rw_req_split() for the update
request. Actually for that case still need to call obj_ec_rw_req_split()
to split the iod->iod_recxs[] for the leader.
2) Fix a bug in dc_obj_query_key
For EC obj, obj_grp_leader_get() possibly return data shard when
parity shard failed, in that case for key query should send RPC
to all data shards.
3) Fix a bug in peer address in EC agg
Fix a bug in peer address (entry->ae_peer_pshards) for multiple
group case.
And a few refines of log msg and err handling.
Add a test case in degrade_ec_update.

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-10015 EC: refine for EC IO with single data target case (#8338)

If with single data target shard, use RPC inline transferring for small
size IO.

Signed-off-by: Xuezhao Liu <xuezhao.liu@intel.com>

DAOS-11120 control: Fix block device size display (#9686)

The hwloc library produces size values in kB, but the
printing library expects bytes.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10954 test: Fix for CID 21969 (#9620)

Free args if mkstemp() fails.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10903 control: Handle leadership loss while processing SWIM events (#9498)

In the rare case that the node processing a SWIM dead event loses
leadership before the membership can be updated, handle the error
by re-forwarding the event so that the new leader will process it.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10813 control: Add block device details to topology (#9313)

The hwloc library provides quite a bit of information about
block devices; make this available. Also adds support for
non-PCI (e.g. PMEM) devices.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-9873 test: Fix more pool tests (#9322)

The following tests were using the check_for_pool() helper
which did not use sudo when looking into SCM:
  pool/multi_server_create_delete.py
  pool/dynamic_server_pool.py

Fix the check_for_pool() helper to use the sudo-aware
check_file_exists() helper, and to return a friendlier
bool value instead of a return code.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10822 pool: Get actual cart group ranks on create (#9334)

Previously, the code was simply generating the group
rank list based on the group size, resulting in intermittent
create failures when the actual group differed from the
generated group.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10368 test: Don't use t.Skip() for disabled tests (#9298)

These tests show up in coverage reports and have to be
revisited on every release. The tests are unable to run
in CI for various reasons, but are still valuable to
run locally in developer environments.

Removes an unreliable and overly-complicated agent
integration test that duplicates unit test coverage.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10378 cont: Adjust cell size prop name to match pool (#9246)

The pool property name is "ec_cell_sz". For command parity
and better UX, adjust the container property name to match.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10798 test: Fix superblock version test (#9289)

This test needs to use sudo when examining the contents
of SCM.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-9873 control: Adjust permissions on mounted SCM filesystem (#8124)

Set the mounted SCM filesystem's root permissions to match the
underlying mountpoint's permissions. Adjust avocado code to
use sudo when looking into SCM.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10643 control: Debounce SWIM Rank Dead events (#9236)

When a rank is seen as dead by multiple other ranks, the
number of events raised may be as large as N-1, where N
is the size of the cluster. As we only care about the first
event for the purpose of updating the system membership,
we can ignore subsequent events for the same rank:incarnation
combination.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10458 build: Move dmg into daos-admin RPM (#8925)

Create a new admin-only RPM to allow installation
independently of client/server dependencies.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10533 test: Remove timeouts in leadership cb test (#9106)

The timeouts were causing occasional spurious failures on slow VMs. There is
still an overall test timeout that will prevent the test from hanging indefinitely.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10633 control: Add dmg system (set|get)-prop commands (#9111)

Add capability to set and get defined system properties via
new commands:
  * dmg system set-prop key:val[,key:val]
  * dmg system get-prop [key,key]

Adds two computed (read-only) system properties:

Name                                    Value
----                                    -----
DAOS system name (daos_system)          daos_server
DAOS version (daos_version)             2.3.100

Features: control

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10611 control: Evict pool handles on agent shutdown (#9052)

When the agent is shut down, it loses all knowledge of
currently-open pool handles on the local node. By default,
it should instead attempt to evict all open pool handles
before shutting down.

This behavior can be overridden by setting the following
in the agent configuration:

disable_auto_evict: true

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10579 tools: Ensure daos list-container JSON is lowercase (#9019)

The default behavior is to use CamelCase; just add json: tags
to the struct fields to make them snake_case.

Features: container

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10594 tools: Allocate cmd_args_s with calloc() (#9011)

Use C-managed memory to avoid any possibility of problems
caused by the Go GC messing with pointers behind the scenes.

Features: autotest

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10495 control: Allow fanout RPCs to report progress (#8955)

Callers may set a reporting callback to be invoked as
HostResponse replies are received. This commit just adds
info-level logging to display finished/waiting ranks,
but the mechanism could be extended for more sophisticated
progress updates sent back to control clients.

Also adds new NumericList/NumericSet types to the hostlist
library to be used as a more efficient/capable basis for
the system.RankSet type.

Features: control

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10526 control: Add block devices to topology scan (#8970)

Allow dump-topology subcommands to include block devices and
their NUMA affinities in the scan output. Also tweaks the pretty-printer
output to group PCI devices by bus.
