Features: control

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10019 control: Create control/lib/daos (#8847)

The drpc package pulls in dependencies like protobufs
that aren't needed by many consumers of the non-dRPC
constants and functions. Create a new standalone daos
package to allow for cleaner imports.

Also fixes cmd/daos property tests to use exported consts
so that they don't need to use cgo directly. This keeps
test-only code out of the produced binary.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10019 control: Move common test code into test-only package (#8670)

This commit is part of a larger cleanup effort to eliminate
"leaky" package boundaries. Production code should not
depend on test code; therefore test code should not be
part of the exported package surface. The next step in
this process will isolate mocks and other test-only
collateral.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

Revert "DAOS-10495 control: Remove inner RPC timeouts for system commands (#8875)" (#8926)

This reverts commit 30a960b698fc2d8453b7b9cd9a0578f3657a3c2b, which
is causing frequent unit test failures in CI.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10387 control: Add system key/val store to MS (#8805)

Add a free-form key/val store to the Management Service to
be used as the basis for system-level attributes and properties.

The initial work will support arbitrary key/val system attributes,
similar to the pool/container attributes. Adds new dmg commands
to manage attributes:

  - dmg system set-attr key:val[,key:val]
  - dmg system get-attr [key[,key]]
  - dmg system del-attr key[,key]

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-5696 test: Update jobtest utility (#7279)

Add support for pool labels, misc cleanups.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-9279 control: Update cmds to use common/cmdutil (#7657)

Adapt commands to use a shared set of embeddable structs
to extend their functionality.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>
DAOS-10019 control: Move raft into its own package (#8476)

DAOS-10194 control: Include pool state in list (#8565)

The pool list handler will now always return the entire
set of pools in the system, regardless of whether or
not they are in the "Ready" state. The pool state is
included in the set of information returned to the
Control client where it can be displayed to the admin.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10222 control: Allow rejoin with NilRank (#8618)

Relax the rejoin rules for this scenario which can occur
when the join partially succeeded (e.g. the member was added,
but the response was not received).

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10194 control: Fix forced PoolDestroy flow (#8598)

The PoolDestroy RPC handler's behavior was changed slightly
with the result that a forced destroy could sometimes fail
to zap the label on the existing pool service. This could
lead to confusing behavior when the admin tries to create a
new pool with the same label.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-8911 control: Set coredump filter on startup (#8485)

The default value includes hugepages, which in most cases
is not desirable and results in unnecessarily large core dump
files.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10168 control: Retry Join on leadership loss (#8550)

In the rare event that a leadership loss occurs while a
request is being processed, return a sentinel error that
will cause some callers (e.g. system.Join()) to retry.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10168 control: Don't exit monitoring loop on leadership loss (#8522)

Fixes a longstanding intermittent failure that can occur when a
node loses MS leadership and then regains it.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-10019 control: Move TopologyCmd to hwprov package (#8475)

Not a perfect home for it, but isolates the dependencies
on hwloc, libfabric, etc.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-9555 control: Suppress spurious UCX error (#8520)

When a given fabric provider is unable to be loaded, don't
print an error, just skip it.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-7673 control: Unlink daos_server/SPDK (#6239)

With the changes landed in commit 40f8636, there
is now a separation between daos_server and daos_admin
such that daos_server does not need to be linked against
SPDK/DPDK. This commit updates the build to remove the
dependencies on those libraries.

Additionally, there is no need to scan to see if VMD is
available before deciding whether or not to enable it. Just
enable it by default. If a non-VMD-aware scan is desired, it
can be disabled via cmdline flag.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-9584 control: Don't retry unimplemented RPCs (#8308)

In the event that a control server's RPC response
indicates that the RPC is unimplemented, don't
retry it and return the error immediately.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-8905 test: Adjust hwloc test for real hardware (#8465)

On more complex systems, the unit test for the worst-case
uncached topology will time out with a large number of
goroutines. In this case, reduce the number of goroutines
to a number that is likely to pass while still testing
thread-safety.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-9818 control: Component interoperability checks (#8084)

Add a framework for performing interoperability checks
between components, and start using it to enforce
interoperability rules.

Current rules:
  * 2.0.0 and above are not backward-compatible with < 2.0.0
  * Components must be patch-compatible (e.g. 2.0.1 <-> 2.0.2)

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

Revert several control plane patches to restore stability (#8321)

Revert "DAOS-9145 control: Fix racy access to engine's exec.Cmd (#8208)"
This reverts commit 5ba33551e31485f131cc60e3b7ceb33e802060c1.

Revert "DAOS-9105 control: Generate VMD-enabled server configs with DMG (#8222)"
This reverts commit bb08dbdaa9d49a00dc1a46e9b90f1ae4cc0f0488.

Revert "DAOS-9782 control: Resolve some interop issues in DMG (#8242)"
This reverts commit 920b794504197ee3044aca767296ea82f959a1f6.

Revert "DAOS-8905 control: Finish removal of netdetect (#7977)"
This reverts commit 1b6fe20a88b4769fad1fb710bffe2179b921cdc7.

Revert "DAOS-9849 control: Correct NVMe count in DMG storage format summary (#8234)"
This reverts commit 8c6b52d7e4024999d9fe3e1b87b385bea9bfa02b.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-9145 control: Fix racy access to engine's exec.Cmd (#8208)

Instead of sharing the cmd field of the runner between goroutines,
delegate access to a single goroutine and communicate with it.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

DAOS-9908 build: Build with go >= 1.17 (#8196)

Ensure that we are building RPMs with the latest release
available in our internal package repositories.

Signed-off-by: Michael MacDonald <mjmac.macdonald@intel.com>

LGTM, just a nit about the fault strings.

commits.message:
DAOS-8870 pool: Allow srv_hdls in TGT_QUERY_MAP (#7082)

ds_pool_tgt_query_map_handler misses (due to my ignorance) the case
where an engine may go through the map_refresh code to refresh a
"client-copy" of the pool map during a rebuild job. This patch fixes the
issue by following the handling "server handles" in
ds_pool_query_handler. Also,

  - Extract a new ds_pool_hdl_is_from_srv API for
    ds_pool_tgt_query_map_handler, to avoid looking up the ds_pool
    object twice.
  - Handle -DER_NOTLEADER from ds_pool_hdl_is_from_srv in
    ds_pool_tgt_query_map_handler and resulting -DER_AGAIN in
    map_refresh_cb.
  - Remove the is_pool_from_srv declaration from daos_engine.h.

Signed-off-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>
DAOS-9592 rsvc: Fix ds_rsvc leaks (#9074)

DAOS-10542 Jenkinsfile: Simplify pb-c patterns (#8975)

Replace

  "<module>/*.pb-c.[ch]"

with

  "*.pb-c.[ch]:"

to avoid the scenario where one adds a new pb-c file but forgets to
update this list.

Signed-off-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>

DAOS-8918 container: Fix key conflict with pool MD (#8824)

The ds_cont_prop_version key conflicts with ds_pool_prop_version. The
two keys refer to the same value in the root RDB KVS. This patch removes
ds_cont_prop_version to avoid future confusions, for using separate
versions for pool and container metadata would be an overkill currently.

The patch also includes some layout-related fixes and improvements:

  - Remove ds_cont_prop_ghce and ds_cont_prop_ghpce, for these were
    deprecated long ago and have not been read since.

  - Fix the value type comments for ds_cont_prop_ec_pda and
    ds-cont_prop_rp_pda.

  - Improve the consistency of value type comments.

How to add layout-version-dependent code to src/container is left to
further discussions (e.g., by exporting and using ds_pool_prop_version
and/or ds_pool_prop_global_version?).

Signed-off-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>

DAOS-9862 rdb: Introduce local TXs (#8539)

This patch introduces special "local" RDB TXs for testing and future
catastrophic recovery purposes. Local TXs can be executed with open but
not yet started DBs, represented by rdb_storage objects. These TXs are
query only and see the latest local DB contents that may include
uncommitted updates. In tests, we can therefore verify DB contents on
any replica, who may or may not be a leader.

Here is a summary of the changes:

- [Core] Add rdb_storage that represents an open but not yet started
DB.
  * Split "start" into "open" then "start", and "stop" into "stop"
then "close".

- Fix a load-snapshot leak on an error path in rdb_raft_load_lc.

- Add a missing ABT_cond_broadcast(db->d_events_cv) call to an error
path in rdb_raft_start.

- Remove some useless ABT_thread_join calls.

- [Core] Add rdb_tx_begin_local.
  * Use a rdb_tx flag to skip the Raft logic.
  * This requires an rdb_storage object because we may have some
concurrency problem if we were to execute a local TX that yields
while there is a concurrent incoming AE request.

- [Core] Fix rdbt to verify DB contents using local TXs instead of
leadership transfers, which are not supported.
  * Disable one test case because it requires a leadership transfer.

Signed-off-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>

DAOS-9875 tests: Set server param crt_timeout=10 (#8434)

Add a 10-second default value for the crt_timeout parameter of
DaosServerYamlParameters, so that tests that may have to wait out full
RPC timeouts can progress faster. This is generally desirable in our
controlled, small-scale CI testing.

Remove the setting of the CRT_TIMEOUT environment variable for pydaos,
which was added due to my ignorance. All libdaos clients are supposed to
get this value from daos_server, who supplies the crt_timeout value from
daos_server.yml.

Signed-off-by: Li Wei wei.g.li@intel.com

DAOS-2554 mgmt: Clean up dRPC handlers a bit (#8729)

Clean up the coding style and some comments of the mgmt dRPC handlers a
bit.

Signed-off-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>

DAOS-10249 rdb: Fix uninitialized raft node ID (#8608)

Since rdb no longer calls raft_add_node when offering each add-node log
entry, it should set the self node ID via the new raft_set_nodeid
method, right after creating the raft_server_t object.

Update raft to pick up the new raft_set_nodeid method as well as a few
minor fixes.

Signed-off-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>

DAOS-10179 rdb: Add missing KVS cache evictions (#8512)

The rdb module caches <KVS path, VOS object ID> pairs for the Log
Container at the last index. When popping log entries, we should empty
this cache just in case that the popping reverts some KVS create
operations and leaves incorrect <KVS path, VOS object ID> pairs in the
cache. This patch adds two such rdb_kvs_cache_evict calls that are
missing when popping entries and when loading snapshots.

The rdb_raft_log_offer_single function has a few error paths that
discards the same index more than once. Since discarding an index may be
expensive, this patch avoids that.

Signed-off-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>

DAOS-6623 pool: Fix pool_tls_fini errors (#8343)

NLT observes errors similar to the following from pool_tls_fini.

02/15-02:40:42.38 boro-15 DAOS[23379/3/0] pool ERR src/pool/srv.c:149
pool_tls_fini() 881d766d: ref: 2
02/15-02:40:42.38 boro-15 DAOS[23379/3/0] pool ERR src/pool/srv.c:153
pool_tls_fini() pool list not empty

At least one reason is that pool_tls_fini is called before the
ds_pool_hdl objects are destroyed. This patch adds an explicit step to
empty pool_hdl_hash.

The new dss_module_info.dmi_srv_shutting_down flag is for preventing new
ds_pool_hdl objects from being added while we empty pool_hdl_hash. In
the future, the flag may also be used for other resources in a similar
manner.

The new environment variable DAOS_STRICT_SHUTDOWN allows tests to
request a non-default, strict mode for shutting down engines. We can use
the strict mode in more and more tests to prevent regressions in this area.

Signed-off-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>

DAOS-9326 rdb: Minor fix in rdb_raft_process_reply (#8168)

In rdb_raft_process_reply, we should hold d_raft_mutex when calling
raft_get_node, for the latter belongs to the raft state machine. Since
raft_get_node doesn't yield, there should not be an issue in practice;
just a fix "on principle".

Signed-off-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>

DAOS-9326 rdb: Campaign only if voting (#8167)

For simplicity (and perhaps correctness), we would like to maintain the
rule that a replica starts an election only if it is a voting node in
its local configuration. (Checking inside raft would be better, though a
bit more API work. We might try that in the future.)

Signed-off-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>

DAOS-9326 rdb: Change replicas only after debut (#8166)

Before making membership changes, an RDB leader must ensure it has
already committed the debut entry. Otherwise, there may be violations of
election safety. See

groups.google.com/g/raft-dev/c/t4xj6dJTP6E/m/d2D9LrWRza8J

for more details. This patch fixes the issue by adopting the same
wait-for-debut mechanism used by rdb_tx_begin.

Also, this patch removes a dead API, rdb_get_uuid.

Signed-off-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>

DAOS-10984 DFS: fix coverity ID 105871, 119081 (#9594)

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-10938 DFS: fix lookup on "/" not setting stbuf (#9527)

Store the root stbuf on dfs_mount and use that when doing a lookup
on root object.

Co-authored-by: Dalton Bohning <dalton.bohning@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-10756 event: check before setting the event to READY (#9529)

- After aquiring the lock in the progress loop, check that the event is still in completed/aborted state before resetting to READY.
- Finalize the thread private event before calling init again to avoid calling pthread_mutex_init on non destroyed mutex.

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-10756 event: move the ev lock to outside the comp_locked function (#9426)

since the function is supposed to be called when everything is locked, we
should do the lock on the ev with no eq outside of the function.

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-625 test: fix test typo (#9427)

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-6654 bigio: re-enable the HDF5 VOL bigio test (#4544)

Re-enable the HDF5 VOL bigio test

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-10601 client: fix daos_event_abort corruption issue (#9175)

daos_event_abort() was marking the event as aborted, however the DAOS
internal task is not aborted, and currently there is no way to abort
that. So later if a user progresses (through test or poll) that aborted
event, the event API frees the event and marks it as ready to initialized
since it was aborted before, but the DAOS internal task is still not done.

When the DAOS task finally progresses, it can cause corruption because the
user might have resused the event, or even reused the buffers that were passed
to the event.

Since we do not support cancellations of internal DAOS tasks and RPCs, change
the abort implementation to just be a no-op for now which would cause a test or poll
on the event to wait till the internal task is completed to avoid such corruption issues.

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-10613 doc: tweak the HDF5 vol doc and point to new build instructions (#9061)


Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-10569 client: fix build on aarch64 (#8986)

* New mutex added in private event did not take into consideration extra
8 byte of mutex size on aarch64. add that padding to private event size.
* move the magic int to be next to the pthread key since both are
4 bytes so compiler doesn't insert an extra 8 byte pads (4 each) when
statically checking the size.

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-10477 dfs: add new APIs to retrieve pool and container handles (#8868)

If a user connect to a DFS container with dfs_connect(), they don't have
access to the pool and container handles that are opened by DFS internally.
Users sometimes need to add attributes or query the pool and container info,
so provide a mechanism to return those internal pool and container handles
with proper refcounting, requiring users to put the handles when done before
umount of dfs.

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-10148 tse: fix TSE task buffer to account for aarch64 architecture (#8747)

* pthread_mutex_t on arm is 8 bytes longer than on x86, so adjust the TSE
preallocated buffer to fix the static compile time assertion.
* update the tse stack sizes to be dependent on each other.
* fix another size issue on aarch64 in dfuse_obj_da.h

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-10202 event: private event needs lock on completion and poll (#8738)

It is possible that the error is not reset to 0 when a process is retrieving the private event in a multi-threaded environment since another thread might have processed the event completion.

add a lock on daos_event_t for events that are not part of an event queue, including the thread private event. This is required because in a multithreaded environment like dfuse, the event can be completed and the error set non
atomically, while the main thread sees the completion but before the error has actually set, causing the owner of the event to reset the event error, with the other thread setting the error after. this affects future use of the event that launches with ev_error already set to the previous error.

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-10175 test: add multi-threaded eq poller tests (#8523)

- add unit test using only event API
- add similar test using DFS IO

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-9822 dfs: track accurate mtime with dfs_stat (#8081)

- Add RPC stack to return max_epoch with key query
- Update key query to optionally return the max_epoch
- Add new Array api (daos_array_stat) that queries the array size and max epoch
- Add CART API to convert epoch to timespec
- Update DFS to use the array stat API instead of array get_size on dfs_stat

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-623 test: bump timeout on oid allocator test (#8418)

to avoid the cascading RPC issue and further CI failures, bump timeout
on test.

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-623 api: suppress unused argument warnings (#8361)

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-9933 dfs: container owner information is not needed in new layout (#8302)

uid and gid are stored per entry and the container ACL is not required
to be used in this new layout version. still need to maintain that in
older layout versions.

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-10009 dfs: fix move and exchange API to have input names const (#8323)

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-623 dfs: fix some coverity warnings in DFS (#8316)

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-9977 test: fix auto class selection test (#8292)

with RF2, the oclass selection changed for EC oclasses, but test was
not updated.

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

DAOS-9567 dfs: add uid & gid to dfs inode entry (#7871)

also bump the layout version and support bwd comp to older containers
with manual version checks.

change the layout to put symlink in a separate akey.
add the symlink length in the inode instead, which is also possibly
a place to cache the file size for regular files in the future.

Signed-off-by: Mohamad Chaarawi <mohamad.chaarawi@intel.com>

CART-89 init: Randomize proto query (#9028)

Randomize protocol query targets at the startup.

Signed-off-by: Alexander A Oganezov <alexander.a.oganezov@intel.com>

CART-89 crtu: Update cart utilities (#9255)

- Update cart utility start client/server code to return errors

Signed-off-by: Alexander A Oganezov <alexander.a.oganezov@intel.com>

DAOS-10673 fixes: remove usage of na_* types (#9153)

- Remove usage of na_* types from the cart in order to allow an update
to the latest mercury that no longer exports those types

Signed-off-by: Alexander A Oganezov <alexander.a.oganezov@intel.com>

DAOS-10226 test: Update internal timeouts (#8817)

Internal timeouts for pings in cart tests were set to 5-10 seconds
causing CI failures under valgrind vm runs or multi-node vm runs
with many servers/clients. Timeouts changes to 50-60 seconds instead

Signed-off-by: Alexander A Oganezov <alexander.a.oganezov@intel.com>

DAOS-10055 test: Adjust ghost rpc test (#8515)

- Adjust ghost rpc test to expect potential DER_HG error when sending
RPC to a dead host

Signed-off-by: Alexander A Oganezov <alexander.a.oganezov@intel.com>

DAOS-10218 test: Adjust timeouts in cart_ctl (#8642)

Fix timeout values in cart_ctl. Bump from 5 to 60 seconds for the
initial wait_for_ranks stage with longer values if valgrind is being used.

Signed-off-by: Alexander A Oganezov <alexander.a.oganezov@intel.com>

CART-89 cxi: Update mercury (#8453)

Update mercury to include CXI provider

Signed-off-by: Alexander A Oganezov <alexander.a.oganezov@intel.com>

DAOS-9561 mercury: Update mercury to include bulk timeout patch (#8278)

Bulk transfer will now have a timeout of 90 seconds.
This addresses an issue with request ULTs being stuck when the client
is down.

Signed-off-by: Alexander A Oganezov <alexander.a.oganezov@intel.com>

DAOS-10683 build: Use nobest with mock (#9665)

To allow dnf builddep to install less-than-latest versions of packages
which have a BR: < $latest.

Also use --setopt=best=0 with dnf upgrade to not error out when the newest
version of a package is available but > R:.

Use dnf with mock on CentOS 7 to be able to use nobest.

Signed-off-by: Brian J. Murrell <brian.murrell@intel.com>

DAOS-623 misc: Small markdown fix (#9105)

* Add lang to the code block

Signed-off-by: Brian J. Murrell <brian.murrell@intel.com>

DAOS-623 misc: Make githooks customizable (#8155)

Modify the githook to add some flexibility to check multiple things

Signed-off-by: Brian J. Murrell <brian.murrell@intel.com>
Co-authored-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>

DAOS-623 ci: Allow fuse to upgrade (#9060)

But don't allow distro packages to upgrade MLNX packages.

Signed-off-by: Brian J. Murrell <brian.murrell@intel.com>

DAOS-9919 test: Don't disable daos repo... (#8866)

Or when an RPM-test-version: pragma has been specified.

Signed-off-by: Brian J. Murrell <brian.murrell@intel.com>

DAOS-9919, CORCI-1170, CORCI-1171 ci: Use Artifactory (#8558)

For Dockerfiles, package building and functional testing.

Fall back to Nexus repos if Artifactory repos fail for any reason and
fall back to on-image repo definition of fetching of repos fails for
any reason.

Move bulk of package installation in Leap 15 Dockerfile to DNF to avoid
cache coherency issues on repository proxies.

Signed-off-by: Brian J. Murrell <brian.murrell@intel.com>

DAOS-9794 build: Build with a generic EL8 (#8206)

Rather than specifying CentOS 8.  This will initially be Rocky Linux
8.5, but could change at any time to be another EL 8 distro such as RHEL
or Almalinux.

Disable core processing CentOS 7 as it's currently broken and causes
test runs to fail.

Signed-off-by: Brian J. Murrell <brian.murrell@intel.com>

DAOS-10006 test: Provide a module config (#8318)

Provide a module config for MOFED openmpi on EL 8.
Also add necessary debuginfo repos for Rocky 8.
Display helpful info when module loading fails
Create utils/exception_utils.py and add MPILoadError exception class
to it.
Move CommandFailure exception class to utils/exception_utils.py.

Signed-off-by: Brian J. Murrell <brian.murrell@intel.com>

reviews.body: I don't really know how or where this file is used, but the change looks reasonable.

commits.message:
DAOS-9881 doc: re-add python venv instructions (#9608)

Doc changes from PR 8816 (commit 6a422f5edade3a1de4ea0885e915c826850b154a)
were made to the wrong file and then deleted in PR 9422 (commit
cf420e9786d2168d096fc63a4ae786754ea25263).

Add pip/venv instructions to the QSG/installation section.

Also clean up references to CentOS 7 in the documentation.

Signed-off-by: Johann Lombardi <johann.lombardi@intel.com>

DAOS-9881 doc: remove install section from admin guide (#9422)

Remove leftover from installation section of the admin
guide that was moved to "installation and set up" a
while ago.

Signed-off-by: Johann Lombardi <johann.lombardi@intel.com>

DAOS-9881 doc: improve perf tuning section (#9374)

Add more examples/explanation for self_test and always use the agent.
Remove selftest section from test and benchmarking.
Document spdk_nvme_perf.
Fix nit which is a source of confusion in dual-rail section.

Signed-off-by: Johann Lombardi <johann.lombardi@intel.com>

DAOS-10431 build: add docker file for EL 9 (#9039)

Add docker file for EL 9 and use AlmaLinux 9
as the baseline.
While all dependencies (SPDK, libfabric, ...) are built,
only the DAOS client is built in the docker file since
some packages (e.g. ipmctl and Lmod) are still missing.
Also disable the java build since it is currently failing.

Signed-off-by: Johann Lombardi <johann.lombardi@intel.com>

DAOS-10205 doc: update object README (#8932)

Update object documentation to match changes done with
the object ID refactoring. Remove client-side replication
since this is not tested/supported any longer.

Signed-off-by: Johann Lombardi <johann.lombardi@intel.com>

DAOS-10431 object: fix client-only build (#8886)

This patch fixes a few issues with client-only build that lies
in the object module.
First of all, header files needed to be split between server
(srv_internal.h) and client (obj_internal.h).
Some of the client-side enumeration and obj_verify code in
turns out to use server-side routines. The code has thus been
split into two file: srv_enum.c (server-specific) and
obj_enum.c (generic).
Some server-side code used between server components has been
exported by adding a new daos_srv/object.h header file.

Signed-off-by: Johann Lombardi <johann.lombardi@intel.com>

DAOS-8781 build: move master to 2.4 test builds (#8638)

Release branch (release/2.2) was created for the 2.2.x release stream.
Master is now moving to 2.4 test builds. Bump version to 2.3.100.

Signed-off-by: Johann Lombardi <johann.lombardi@intel.com>

DAOS-10124 engine: use strict CPU binding (#8462)

It looks like the OS can still decide to move target to a different
CPU. Try to use strict core binding if supported by the platform.

Signed-off-by: Johann Lombardi <johann.lombardi@intel.com>

DAOS-8054 metrics: revisit pool/cont metrics (#6856)

Align pool and container metrics to be aligned with other metrics
tracking number of operations/rpcs instead of state.
Update Grafana dashboard accordingly.

Signed-off-by: Johann Lombardi <johann.lombardi@intel.com>

DAOS-9881 doc: update SuSE instructions to use 15.3 (#8391)

Also add a space after !!! for !!! note for consistency with
the rest of the documentation.

Signed-off-by: Johann Lombardi <johann.lombardi@intel.com>

DAOS-10743 dtx: test case for handle DTX commit failure (#9458)

New fail_loc to simulate the case that one of DTX participants failed
to commit some DTX locally, under such case, as long as one of others
commit the DTX successfully, such DTX will not be aborted.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10961 vos: dynamically allocate space for DTX commit (#9609)

For resolving some coverity complaint.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10348 object: clone sub requests for CPD RPC (#8751)

For OSA case, more than one object shards may reside on the same
DAOS target. So daos_cpd_disp_ent::dcde_write_cnt may be not the
real count of update sub requests. When dispatch CPD RPC, we need
to clone related sub requests to avoid sending some irrelevant sub
request to the remote DAOS target. During the clone operation, we
need to avoid copying the same sub request that are for the same
object's different but co-located shards repeatedly.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-11036 dtx: handle DTX_REFRESH during DTX leader switch (#9567)

If some DAOS engine is evicted, then related pool map will be updated
to related DAOS targets asynchronously. It may cause DTX leader switch
for some DTX entries. Since the pool map update is asynchronous, then
it is possible that the new DTX leader may not realize that it becomes
the DTX leader but some other non-leader has already sent DTX_REFRESH
RPC to it to query such DTX status. Under such case, if the new leader
replies with "DTX_ST_PREPARED" to the non-leader, it may misguide the
non-leader to skip such DTX entry and return old data to client. It is
wrong. Instead, since DTX_REFRESH is only sent to DTX leader, the new
leader can reply -DER_INPROGRESS to make related RPC sponsor to retry
sometime later (until DTX resync for such DTX entry is done on the new
leader).

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10870 dtx: handle active DTX entry update properly (#9489)

For any transaction, the DTX entry in the active DTX table is unique.
So when we allocate new DTX entry in the active DTX table, we should
not hit the entry with the same DTX ID. If that happened, then there
may be two possible cases:

1. Client resent the RPC but without set 'RESEND' flag.
2. Client reused the DTX ID for different modifications.

Currently, the 1st case is more suspected which is DAOS client logic
bug, need to be fixed correspondingly. If it is the 2nd case, we can
re-generate new TX ID.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10352 dtx: limited DTX batched commit ULTs (#9264)

Ideally, dedicated DXT batched commit ULT for each opened container
is the most simple model. But it may be burden for the engine if
opened containers become more and more on the target. So it is
necessary to restrict the count for DTX batched commit ULTs on the
target. It can be adjusted via environment "DAOS_DTX_BATCHED_ULT_MAX"
when load the module. "0" means unlimited.

The patch adds the description for DTX related environment variables
into DAOS document.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10743 dtx: not rollback partially committed DTX (#9309)

For DAOS two-phase-commit based transaction model, during DTX commit,
as long as one participant successfully commit the DTX locally, then
regardless whether the other participants commit successfully or not,
such DTX will be regarded as 'committed' globally. Under such case,
even if some participants failed to commit related DTX locally, we
still cannot rollback the partially committed DTX via DTX_ABORT,
unless all participants totally failed to commit related DTX.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10204 dtx: handle per akey based conditional (#9282)

modification

If a distributed transaction contains per akey based modification,
then we need to check every related akey's existence via each own
sub-task independently. Each one is a conditional akey fetch task.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10204 dtx: delay IO forward for conditional ops during rebuild (#8828)

During object rebuild, if the client triggers conditional operation
on the object that is in rebuilding, then condition check cannot be
properly handled on the in-rebuilding target as to cause unexpected
result when double failures happened.

To resolve such trouble, we will delay IO forwarding of conditional
sub requests to the in-rebuilding targets until the healthy targets
have processed related condition check.

From client perspective, related RPC will become slow, but consider
that the case (conditionally modify the in-rebuilding object shard)
is rare, then the total overhead is not too much.

For conditional modification against EC object, if all parity nodes
are lost, then it will be handled via distributed transaction.

This patch also contains some fixes:

1) In dc_tx_convert logic for update/punch with condition and needs
   to be handled via distributed transaction. In old implementation
   the condition check was discarded by wrong during the convert.

2) For distributed transaction, if the conditional modification has
   DAOS_COND_PER_AKEY flag, it will be handled as non per-akey when
   do the conditional fetch.

3) When check existence in VOS, do not prepare sub tree under akey.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10188 dtx: handle race between DTX aggregation and DTX refresh (#8600)

There is race between DTX aggregation and DTX refresh. Consider the
following scenario:

The DTX leader triggers DTX commit for some DTX entry, then related
DTX participants (including the leader itself) will commit the DTX
entry on each own target in parallel. It is possible that the leader
has already committed locally but DTX aggregation removed the committed
DTX very shortly after the commit. On the other hand, on some non-leader
before the local commit, someone triggers DTX refresh for such DTX on
such non-leader. Unfortunately the DTX entry has already gone on the
leader. Then the non-leader will get -DER_TX_UNCERTAIN, that will cause
related application to fail unexpectedly.

So even if the system has DRAM pressue, we still need to keep some very
recent committed DTX entries to handle above race.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10189 common: fix typo in daos_errno.h (#8602)

Typo for DER_TX_UNCERTAIN description.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10221 dtx: reset DTX handle before yield (#8615)

Currently, we use tls to pass DTX handle in VOS. So if any ULT yield
or exit without reset the DTX handle, then it will affect subsequent
ULT's running.

On the other hand, for EC aggregation, since the aggregation leader
is always the last parity node that is also the DTX leader, then it
is unnecessary to trigger DTX refresh for EC aggregation. The patch
removes related logic and avoids the trouble caused by yield during
EC aggregation.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10199 cont: close potential leaked open handle before stop (#8588)

If the DAOS target is excluded with some container opened, then
related container handle on the exlcuded target will be leaked.

The patch force closes all potential leaked open handles when
stop the container.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10131 dtx: IO forward ULT avoids holding CPU for too long (#8493)

If there are too many sub requests to be handled by IO forward ULT,
then need to yield CPU periodically during the process (even if for
handling failure case) to avoid holding CPU for too long time.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-9860 dtx: do not skip DTX resync (#8455)

Even if no application open the container, or someone just did DTX
resync against the container but current DTX resync is for discard
old DTX entries, then current DTX resync should not be skipped.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-9860 dtx: discard stale active DTX entries for reintegration (#8191)

When a DAOS target is down, related active DTX entries on it will
be handled via DTX resync by other alive targets: either committed
or aborted. When the target is reintegrated back, these DTX entries
are stale and need to be discarded before doing real data migration.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-10045 dtx: not cleanup old DTX entry with leader on current target (#8386)

The DTX cleanup ULT cannot know whether current DTX leader is still alive
or not. There is race case that the DTX leader is blocked because of some
non-leader(s) no-respond (down/crashed) then the DTX cleanup ULT may make
wrong decision to commit the DTX, but the DTX leader would abort such DTX
after related IO RPC to the bad non-leader(s) timeout.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-9570 object: allow degrade IO on EC obj even if lost all parity shards (#8134)

If all data shards are healthy, only parity shards are unavailable, then EC
related logic can guarantee the data consistency.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-9760 dtx: use helper ULT for DTX RPC if has enough helper XS (#8091)

If there is not enough helper XS, then starting more ULT on the helper
XS cannot give much help to DTX RPC handling.

The patch also allows admin to adjust the threshold for using helper ULT
to handle DTX RPC when start DAOS engine via the server side environment
"DTX_RPC_HELPER_THD", "0" means disable helper ULT to handle DTX RPC.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-9829 dtx: keep active DTX entry when close container (#8190)

Some IO requests may be still inflight when close the container
because of malicious or non-coordinated applications or evicted
by administrator by force. Those inflight IO requests may still
reference related active DTX entries that should be kept during
reset DTX tables when close the container.

On the other hand, the patch also adds some check for the cases
of container closed before IO requests completed.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-9639 engine: use large stack for nvme pull ULT (#8238)

To avoid ULT stack overflow.

Signed-off-by: Fan Yong <fan.yong@intel.com>

DAOS-8943 sched: small fix for io throttling (#9459)

Don't check SW_MIN_WEIGHTS for io throttling, otherwise, the io won't
be throttled for low IOPS application (large io size to NVMe).

Slightly Adjusted scheduler parameters.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-10399 object: yield on initiating bulk transfers (#9356)

To avoid resource being exhausted in network stack layers, yield needs
be called on initiating every 1k IOVs bulk transfers, so that cart
progress will be able to kick in to complete some inflight bulk transfers.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-10372 bio: wait DMA buffer in FIFO order (#9584)

When DMA buffer is exhausted by heavy workload, the IO request which
failed to grab DMA buffer will have to wait for prior IO's completion,
starvation could happen in following scenario:

- Request A failed to grab buffer, it starts waiting for prior IO done;
- Later request B arrived server, it's pushed into ABT pool FIFO queue
  for execution;
- Prior IO completed, it wakeup request A, and request A is pushed into
  ABT pool FIFO queue for execution;
- Request B will be processed before request A, and request A may have
  to wait for another round if DMA buffer is used up by request B;

Another issue is that once prior IO completed, all waiters will be
woken up even if the released buffer can satisfy only fewer waiters,
that'll waste CPU cycles unnecessarily.

This patch solved the starvation issue by ensuring all incoming requests
waiting in a FIFO queue when there is any prior request waiting for DMA
buffer, also, the waiters will be woke up one by one in FIFO order.

This patch also introduced telemetry for DMA buffer management, the
error messages emitted on grabbing buffer failures are rate limited.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-8943 vea: optimize aging frag flushing (#9147)

1. Instead of triggering aging frags flush in vea_reserve() and vea_free()
   internally, using a dedicated ULT to do flush externally, there are two
   advantages of external flush:

   - GC & Aggregation ULT won't be blocked on waiting for the NVMe unmap
     completion;
   - It's easier to control the flush rate and other parameters according
     to space pressure;

   Standalone VOS still uses internal flush triggered in vea_reserve() and
   vea_free().

2. Use the new BIO API bio_blob_unmap_sgl() to unmap multiple freed frags
   in parallel, that could reduce the total unmap latency;

3. Stop merging the aging frag when it reached a size threshold, otherwise,
   the frag could be constantly merged with newly freed frag and stay in
   the aging buffer for too long;

4. Adjust flush parameters to make the frags being flushed more promptly;

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-10367 vos: replace snprintf with D_ASPRINTF (#9338)

Replace snprintf with D_ASPRINTF in vos self init.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-5813 vos: get rid of NVMe reservation (#9280)

Don't reserve NVMe for dealing with fragmentation issues, otherwise,
there will be big chunk of NVMe space not available for user.
Without NVMe reservation, NVMe allocation could fail due to
fragmentations, but that will only affect the data coalescing during
aggregation, space reclaiming by punch and GC won't be affected.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-10748 bio: missed error code in bulk_map_one() (#9265)

bulk_map_one() mistakenly ignored the error code returned from
dma_map_one(), that could result in bio_iod_prep() succeeds even
when it actually fails in dma_map_one().

flush_one() can skip pmem flush when it's not direct SCM access
(DMA buffer is used for SCM bulk transfer by default).

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-10131 tests: enable watchdog for VOS xstreams (#9089)

Enable watchdog for VOS xstreams.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-10367 tests: enable NVMe for VOS unit tests (#8822)

Enable NVMe when running VOS unit tests.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-9991 bio: split large IO (#8943)

Split large IO into chunk size IOs (8MB by default) to avoid exceeding
the SPDK bdev single IO size limit.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-10289 bio: tuneable SPDK subsystem fini timeout (#8705)

To analyze the issue of SPDK subsystem fini timeout on certain
cluster node, this patch makes the SPDK subsystem fini timeout
tuneable through through env var "DAOS_SPDK_SUBSYS_TIMEOUT".

The default timeout value is 9000 ms, one can change the default
value by setting "DAOS_SPDK_SUBSYS_TIMEOUT" to a different value
or disable timeout by setting "DAOS_SPDK_SUBSYS_TIMEOUT" to 0.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-623 vos: fix typo in vos aggregation (#8599)

Fixed a typo in VOS aggregation.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-9054 sched: finer CPU apportioning (#8513)

To achieve finer CPU apportioning for ULTs within same DAOS pool,
a per-pool 'stats window' is introduced to track kicked off ULTs
(per ULT type) within the last N schedule cycles.

This historical statistical data could facilitate finer internal sys
ULT throttling when there is no space pressure; Combinded with the
space pressure info, it could facilitate smoother update throttling
when the pool is under space pressure.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-9651 vos: Aggregation & GC harnessing (#8284)

Harness aggregation & GC ULTs according to the space pressure and
system activities:

- When system is idle, EC/VOS aggregation and GC will be running
  in tight mode which does less yield (that can reduce re-probe
  on iterating when back from yield); When system is busy, they
  will be running in slack mode which does yield more often (that
  can avoid io performance fluctuation).

- Once EC/VOS aggregation or GC ULT back from yield, it'll check
  if system is busy and decide to run in tight mode or slack mode
  till next yield. More credits will be used for tight mode and
  fewer credits will be used for slack mode.

- When EC/VOS aggregation and GC ULTs are running in slack mode
  and there is no space pressure, they will take an extra sleep
  on each yielding.

- Refined VOS aggreation credits to differentiate plain iteration
  and delete, merge operations.

- Minor code cleanup in src/container/srv_target.c.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-9896 sched: check if network poll started (#8197)

Before network poll started, for instance, when the cart progress
ULT is blocked on open barrier (waiting for join PG), scheduler
shouldn't rely on the blocking crt_progress(timeout) call to relax
CPU, instead, it should just call usleep().

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-9940 sched: differentiating RDB heartbeat request (#8257)

Scheduler needs to differentiate RDB heartbeat request and ignore
them when trying to enter relaxing mode, otherwise, the system
xstream on heartbeat receiver side will never enter relaxing mode.

Use sched_cond_wait() instead of ABT_cond_wait() for events handler
ULT, otherwise, scheduler won't enter relaxing mode.

Signed-off-by: Niu Yawei <yawei.niu@intel.com>

DAOS-10863 control: Fix log message (#9512)

Fixed a typographical error.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-10863 control: Log warning for single access point (#9395)

While using a single access point is allowed, it provides no
redundancy. This log message provides a warning for the admin.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-10661 control: Use DB replica addr for JoinReq (#9327)

Replicas sending a Join request need to report the same ControlAddr
as the management service DB includes in its replica list. Without
this, on systems with multiple IP addresses on the same subnet,
the MS can fail to recognize itself and other nodes as replicas.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-WIP control: Improve UCX transport support (#9214)

- Add support for ucx+all alias.
- Stop scanning non-network components. For now we will limit
  scanning to the infiniband (ib) and tcp components.
- For tcp, don't attempt to build a multirail device name.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-10600 ci: Prevent UCX pkg from breaking MLNX (#9152)

There was a conflict between UCX and Mellanox packages on some
CI nodes.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-10539 build: Autodetect UCX (#8967)

Build UCX support in the control plane and in Mercury (if we are
building dependencies) if the UCX libraries/headers are detected.

Features: control

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-10395 agent: Add component incompatibility error (#9072)

- Add a new error, DER_CONTROL_INCOMPAT, to indicate that control
  plane components (agent, server, dmg) are not compatible.
- Return the new error as a status code to client processes if the
  agent discovers it is not compatible with the DAOS server.
- Fix broken GetAttachInfo unit test.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-10530 agent: Fix NUMA node rotation (#8973)

The agent was assuming NUMA nodes were sorted by index rather than
ID for load balancing purposes. This broke in cases with network
interfaces on non-sequential NUMA nodes.

Feature: control

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-10358 control: Detect virtual net interfaces (#8954)

The control plane can now detect virtual network interfaces as
part of the hardware topology. This allows end users to specify
a software-created interface like a sub-interface or a network
bridge for DAOS to use.

These changes also enable DAOS to detect multiple network devices
per fabric domain.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-9923 agent: Wait for fabric ready before scan (#8877)

The agent must, similar to the server, wait for fabric interfaces
to become ready before performing a full fabric scan. In the agent
we scan as needed, so it won't happen until the client makes a
GetAttachInfo call.

- Add mechanism for agent to check fabric readiness for the relevant
  class of net interfaces for the GetAttachInfo call. This will
  happen only before the fabric scan, which means cached fabric info
  will not require a re-check.
- Refactor hardware.FabricReadyChecker into NetDevStateProvider,
  which fetches the state directly, for the caller to act on.
- Replace sysfs.Provider CheckFabricReady() function with
  GetNetDevState(). This gets the state of ordinary net interfaces
  as well as IB. The logic for multi-device/multi-port configs
  is more sophisticated now: A device is ready only when all ports
  that could become ready are.
- Allow WaitFabricReady() to ignore interfaces that aren't usable
  (i.e. down/disabled or in an unknown state). If not ignored, these
  states cause the function to fail.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-10436 control: Don't call fi_getinfo with empty hint (#8820)

With libfabric v1.15.0 release candidates, an empty hint resulted
in fabric interfaces not being returned.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-9923 control: Wait for IB to be ready (#8730)

Wait for infiniband fabric interfaces to be ready before scanning
for their details on daos_server startup.

- Add method to check fabric readiness via sysfs. It checks the same
  sysfs data used by ibstat/libibumad to determine if the interface
  is active.
- Add function hardware.WaitFabricReady to loop on ready checks,
  with a configurable sleep between loops. It will be canceled when
  the context is canceled.
- Log an informative message at error level if a fabric interface
  isn't ready.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-10150 agent: Load balance amongst NUMA nodes (#8782)

If the client process's NUMA node doesn't have a local network
interface that is usable with DAOS, we now load-balance among
all other interfaces across NUMA nodes.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-8752 control: Fix dmg cont set-owner to use svc ranks (#8668)

The dmg cont set-owner command wasn't updated to include the pool
service ranks.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-10072 test: Add new pool query fields to test (#8656)

Pool query now provides "enabled_ranks" and "disabled_ranks" fields.
In the basic case, they aren't returned.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-8052 agent: Add disable_caching option to config (#8629)

A new daos_agent configuration option, disable_caching, can be used
to avoid caching the GetAttachInfo response and local fabric hardware
details when clients request engine URIs. If disable_caching is set to
true, the agent will query the access point and rescan the hardware
every time a client requests the URIs.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-10256 control: Allow ucx+dc_x provider (#8636)

We were previously accepting only the ucx+dc alias. ucx+dc_x is
also valid.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-9555 control: Detect UCX fabric interfaces (#8160)

This patch enables detection of UCX fabric interfaces. Either
libfabric, UCX, or both may be installed at runtime. Both
libfabric and UCX are required at build time in order to build
with UCX support.

  * Add dynamic UCX bindings and new UCX FabricInterfaceProvider.
  * Add the UCX provider to the list of default
    FabricInterfaceProviders, if building with UCX.
  * Fail early if no fabric provider is installed.
  * Translate UCX transport strings to those used by the server.
  * Refactor FabricInterface to better represent the distinction
    between name as reported by the fabric library, name as it
    appears in the hardware topology, and its associated net
    device. UCX reports a different device name than what appears
    in the topology.
  * Conditionally build ucx support with scons flag UCX=1. Also
    updated Mercury build to use this flag instead of detecting
    the library at build time.
  * Make the UCX OFI_DOMAIN name a combination of all device names.
    Not sure why this is required, but it is needed for multi-engine
    support.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-8905 control: Finish removal of netdetect (#8339)

  * Replace function to get NUMA node for PID.
  * Delete original netdetect lib.
  * Use RWMutex to control access to hwloc_topology_t instances.
    The hwloc library is re-entrant, so concurrent accesses need only
    be controlled based on the topology instance.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-10050 control: Scan all net providers in config gen (#8403)

In the unusual case where the server already had a configuration,
the network scan during config generate was limited to the
provider already configured. This led to confusing results.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-9555 control: Access libfabric dynamically (#7994)

Instead of directly linking to libfabric in the build, open it
and access its functions dynamically at runtime.

The purpose of this is to make it possible to use different fabric
libraries at runtime depending on what the user has installed
(e.g. UCX).

Copy CoreOS dlopen lib into DAOS source tree. This is necessary
to comply with Intel dependency security requirements.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-9643 agent: Add log level to agent config file (#8324)

- Add control_log_mask to agent config file to specify agent log
  level.
- Set default test agent log level to debug.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

DAOS-8905 control: Finish removal of netdetect (#7977)

- Replace function to get NUMA node for PID.
- Delete original netdetect lib.

Signed-off-by: Kris Jacque <kristin.jacque@intel.com>

reviews.body: In the end I'm not going to block on this. However I think there are a number of minor issues that would benefit from a follow-on to clean up.

DAOS-9385 test: Add agent failure test (#8368)

Verify agent failure is properly handled.

1. Create a pool and a container.
2. Run IOR.
3. Stop daos_agent process while IOR is running.
4. Check the error on the client side. When daos_agent is killed in the middle of IOR, the file write completes successfully, but the pool disconnect at the end fails, so we get the error message that includes -1005. This step is more like a verification of the test itself rather than the product.
5. Verify daos_server doesn’t have the pool handle opened. Call:
dmg telemetry metrics query --metrics=engine_pool_pool_handles
that shows the number of open pool handle. Verify that it's 0 after the agent is stopped and IOR is finished. This step verifies the isolation of the failure. In this case, daos_agent was stopped, but daos_server can detect it and close the pool handle.
6. Verify journalctl shows the log that the agent is stopped. Call:
journalctl --system -t daos_agent --since <before> --until <after>
This step verifies that DAOS, or daos_agent process in this case, prints useful logs for the user to troubleshoot the issue, which in this case the application can’t be used.
7. Restart daos_agent.
8. Run IOR again. It should succeed this time without any error. This step verifies that DAOS can recover from the fault with minimal human intervention.

Signed-off-by: Makito Kano <makito.kano@intel.com>

DAOS-10114 test: Use JSON output for daos container get-prop (#8454)

Update container_get_prop() to use --json. The change affects the four tests in the "Tag - File" section.

In terms of checking the effect of the change, the datamover and erasurecode tests directly call container_get_prop(). The reason we use cont_sec tag for cont_acl.py is the following.

In the security/cont_acl.py test case, it calls verify_cont_rw_property(), which is in the following file:

util/pool_security_test_base.py
where verify_cont_rw_property() calls get_container_property(), which is in the following file:

util/cont_security_test_base.py
where get_container_property() calls container_get_prop(), which is where I made the change to use JSON.

This is the single code path. i.e., no one else calls verify_cont_rw_property() or get_container_property(). Thus, with the additional three tags, we cover all the affected changes with this PR.

Tag - File
cont_sec - security/cont_acl.py
dm_dst_create - datamover/dst_create.py
dm_preserve_props_fs_copy_posix_dfs - datamover/posix_preserve_props.py

DAOS-9935 ftest: Increase wait for ranks time under Valgrind (#8435)

Increase wait for ranks time under Valgrind also.

Signed-off-by: Dmitry Eremin <dmitry.eremin@intel.com>

DAOS-10929 container: fix size of cont_global_version value (#9545)

Before this change, when a new container was created, the metadata
rdb value for key ds_cont_prop_cont_global_version was written as
a 64-bit value in cont_prop_write(). However, the intent for this
recently-added key is a uint32_t typed value. Also, an inconsistency
exists with the pool/container layout upgrade code, upgrade_cont_cb()
writing the value as uint32_t. This results in some containers with
64-bit version values, and others with 32-bit values.

With this change, the cont_prop_write() and cont_prop_read() functions
are changed to write and read a 32-bit cont_global_version value in rdb,
to agree with the upgrade_cont_cb() code.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>

DAOS-10960 pool,container,rsvc: fix Coverity issues (#9571)

Issue 1: explicit null dereference

rsvc_client_complete_rpc() when rc_crt is -DER_INVAL in a debug log
dereferences ep->ep_grp that may be NULL. Remove that part of the
log message.

from src/pool/srv_pool.c callers, should fix:
CID: 105938, 105927, 105888, 105870, 105862, 105844, 105830, 105829
CID: 105815

from src/container/srv_container.c callers, should fix:
CID: 105873

Issue 2: unchecked return value of rsvc_client_choose()
Add error return value checks.
Addresses issues in ds_pool_extend() and ds_pool_target_update_state():
CID: 105812, 105847

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>
Co-authored-by: Li Wei <wei.g.li@intel.com>

DAOS-10448 test: reduce SCM size in create_all_vm/other tests (#9291)

Before this change, in virtual machine (VM)-based testing of the
pool create_all tests, intermittent failures were seen due to
slow/laggy performance on the VM nodes. This resulted in RPC timeouts
in daos_engine during pool create/destroy operations. This is not a
a new phenomenon. Previously it has been seen with other VM-based tests,
requiring a smaller scm_size setting to alleviate memory pressure.

With this change, the scm_size parameter is reduced in this test
and in the following tests (and addressing the associated tickets):
- container/query_properties (DAOS-10487)
- telemetry/dkey_akey_enum_punch (DAOS-10487)
- control/dmg_telemetry_basic (DAOS-10528)

Longer term for create_all_vm, it may be better to eliiminate it,
relying instead on the nearly-identical pool/create_all_hw.py tests.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>

DAOS-10255 test: adjust minimum containers expectation again (#9162)

Significantly reduce the test's expectation of the minimum number of
containers that can be created in a pool, since frequent changes to
metadata layouts have an impact that triggers test failures. And since
the tests are currently designed to fill the metadata  on purpose,
rather than expect a specific quantity.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>

DAOS-9167 tools,control: add dmg pool query-targets (#9110)

Before this change libdaos API function daos_pool_query_target()
and the daos utility, "pool query-targets" command was provided to
inspect a given pool engine's targets (to see up/down state, storage
capacity/usage, etc.).

With this change, dmg pool query-targets is added to allow an admin to
inspect a given pool engine's targets.

Examples of the essential parts of the dmg command line:
  * dmg pool query-targets mypool --rank=6 --target-idx=3
  * dmg pool query-targets mypool --rank=0 --target-idx=0,1,5,7
  * dmg pool query-targets mypool -j --rank=0 --target-idx=0,1,5,7

A mgmt daos_server gRPC handler is implemented, and a corresponding
engine drpc handler that interacts with the pool service. The control
library adds a PoolQueryTarget method to initiate the gRPC from the
dmg utility side, and convert the protobuf reply to PoolQueryTargetResp
form for printing. And the new dmg command implementation is added.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>

DAOS-9167 tools,control: add daos pool query-targets (#8722)

Before this change libdaos API function daos_pool_query_target()
was implemented but inaccessible via user-level utilities (daos)
and admin-level control plane utilities (dmg).

With this change, daos pool query-targets is added to allow a user
to inspect a given pool engine's targets, for example to inspect
target state (up/down), storage capacity and usage, etc.

Example command lines:
  * daos pool query-targets mypool --rank=6 --target-idx=3
  * daos pool query-targets mypool --rank=0 --target-idx=0,1,5,7

A future patch will implement dmg pool query-targets.

A similar approach is taken to daos/dmg implementation of the existing
pool query commands. The target information is represented in protobuf
form, a dmg pretty print function is implemented, and is called by
both daos (after converting API-returned data to protobuf) and dmg.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>

DAOS-10210 debug: logging fixes and improvements (#8630)

This change is organized into three rough areas listed below.

1. Several debug log statements are changed so that common metadata
related log entries are included in the daos default DD_MASK group.
With this change, all usages of D_DEBUG(DF_DSMS, ...) are changed
to a more appropriate (and in some cases default-enabled) debug log
stream such as:

- DB_MD (metadata, for code running on pool/container service engines)
- DB_MGMT (management, for code running on a management service engine)
The DB_MD logs are enabled by default in DB_GRP1 in the code, so that
when then engine log_mask is DEBUG, important pool/container resource
related logging will automatically be included in the engine logs.
Some instances of DB_MGMT are re-categorized to DB_MD as appropriate
for where the code is running (in pool/cont service or mgmt engine).

Also remove the client-specific macro DF_DSMC used in many D_DEBUG
statements. This mapped to DB_ANY, an "uncategorized" stream of debug
log messages. The vast majority of these in pool and container libdaos
client code have now been mapped to DB_MD to reflect in this case that the
client is interacting with the pool/container metadata service.
Remaining uses of DF_DSMC are replaced with direct use of DB_ANY.

2. New DD_MASK groups added for metadata-specific logging use cases
Add two new "group" debug log masks named "group_metadata_only" and
"group_metadata". These names allow an easy DD_MASK setting to gather
metadata-relevant (pool and container operations) logging. A use case
is for gathering logging for a bug report if a pool or container
cannot be created or destroyed as expected.

An admin may assign the DD_MASK environment variable
to one of these values, in the daos_engine configuration and in
the client environment. When DD_MASK=group_metadata_only, only
metadata-specific debug bits will be enabled (mgmt, md).
When DD_MASK=group_metadata, the daos default "group_default" bits
and the additional non-default metadata (mgmt) bits will be enabled.

Some functional tests that previously specified engine configuration
DD_MASK=mgmt,md,dsms,any are changed to specify group_metadata_only.

Documentation is updated for the new group masks, including adding
some examples in the common use cases section.

3. Documentation has been updated and some errors fixed.
A lign debug subsystems/facilities listed in code and documentation.
Add existing subsystems to doc, and remove nonexistent ones from doc.
And fix some typos (eio -> bio, and DD_LOG_MASK -> D_LOG_MASK).

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>

DAOS-10030 doc: fix Doxygen warnings and GHA technical debt. (#8553)

Signed-off-by: Ashley Pittman <ashley.m.pittman@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>

DAOS-9166 pool: coverity CID 351284 illegal accesses (#8567)

pool_query_cb() calls d_rank_list_free(ranks) where ranks should be
assigned (non-NULL) when the preceding process_query_reply() succeeds.
However, Coverity is flagging the usage. Initialize ranks to NULL.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>

DAOS-9166 pool: drpc pool query get rank ranges (#8531)

In the mgmt drpc handler in the engine, convert the pool query ranks
into a rank range list, and a string representation. This is to
support control plane development, returning the ranges string
representation to the control plane client (e.g., dmg utility).

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>

DAOS-10030 doc: fix a few more doxygen rendering issues (#8404)

Replace "# " with "number of".
Add a link to existing structure member rather than \a emphasis.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>

DAOS-9166 pool: MS engine infrastructure for pool query ranks (#8394)

With this change, pool query rank information is added in the
MS engine code (it was in libdaos client code only before).
This change will enable a subsequent patch to pass the
information back through dRPC to MS daos_server and gRPC to dmg.

A more specific summary of changes:
  * MS engine code process_query_result() function gets pool storage
    ranks from the pool map returned (bulk xfer of POOL_QUERY) by the PS.
    And the list passed up the call stack to ds_mgmt_drpc_pool_query().
  * pool_map_get_ranks() is moved from libdaos client code into common
    pool map code and called by both libdaos clients and daos_engine.
  * drpc unit testing for pool query (srv_drpc_tests) mocking updated
    for ranks list output.
  * a few small code improvements in existing code in this code path.
    e.g., using DF_RC/DP_RC(rc) in log messages, and D_GOTO -> goto
    where rc assignment is not needed.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>

DAOS-9166 pool, api: query output rank information (#8311)

Before this change, the daos_pool_query() API "tgts" output argument
was not populated. With this change, the interface is clarified,
and an implementation provided. The "tgts" argument is now renamed
"ranks". When a pool query is issued passing in a daos_pool_info_t
argument, if there are some disabled targets (i.e., pi_ndisabled > 0
in the returned info), the ranks list will consist of those pool
storage engines associated with the disabled/down targets. If on the
other hand no targets in the pool are disabled (pi_ndisabled == 0),
the ranks list will consist of all current pool storage engines
(found to be up in the pool map).

In this change, for more compact debug logging of returned ranks,
new gurt types / functions are added. A list of rank ranges type
d_rank_range_list_t is added, and can be created from a d_rank_list_t.

Also in this change, the daos_test is modified in some daos_pool_query()
calls (e.g., in pool_op_retry) to pass a rank list.

In a future patch, more work is needed to update the Go-based
daos and dmg utilities. The rank list / rank range information is
needed in the tools to present them in the command output to the
end-user. Currently for example, the daos utility does not pass
a d_rank_list_t through the CGo invocatio to libdaos, so no information
can be returned presently. The dmg-related work may be more involved,
potentially with gRPC protobuf changes, and (TBD) processing the
pool map on the server/engine side rather than the client side.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>

DAOS-9519 mgmt: reduce MGMT_POOL_FIND RPC timeouts (#8279)

Speed up client finding pool service replicas particularly for the
situation that a daos_engine rank is no longer reachable. Reduce
the MGMT_POOL_FIND RPC timeout to 1/4 the cart RPC timeout, with
a lower bound of 10 seconds timeout.

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Cain <kenneth.c.cain@intel.com>
DAOS-10030 doc: fix some undocumented API structures, members (#8349)

reviews.body:
I reviewed this unclean cherry-pick of master commit cf2a54f773305cb887446be8926698f65d5641e7 by trying to apply it myself and verifying that the changes in this PR match what the conflict resolution should be (content in master but not ported to release/2.2 should not be brought into the patch). It looks good from what I can see.

I guess the other change is that there is a second commit brought in explicitly - CART-89 init: Randomize proto query PR 9028 - that I guess is not controversial, but I wonder why PR https://github.com/daos-stack/daos/pull/9028 was not picked to release/2.2 branch before?

This patch looks good for fixing the problem of unable to destroy a 2.0 pool (with a leftover 2.0 pool_hdl) using 2.2+ software.

It seems there may be more work though (perhaps in a separate patch, or even a different ticket from DAOS-10471?) to change other places in the code that read/write pool_hdl in the ps_handles KVS. For example if there is a 2.0 format pool, not yet upgraded to 2.2 format, and the 2.2 software gets a pool connect request, it seems it will successfully connect, but will use the 2.2 format pool_hdl here.

I think the C changes are good based on my previous inspection. Approving now, realizing that this PR needs to merge latest master. A lot of the diffs here are already incorporated in this commit just landed to master. So maybe the patch will get a lot smaller after merging.
landed https://github.com/daos-stack/daos/commit/cf2a54f773305cb887446be8926698f65d5641e7

Looks good, although the different versioning fields and variables are sometimes difficult to read and interpret.

- RPC pci_pool_version is a layout format version (1 currently, 2 later with another patch)
- DAOS_POOL_GLOBAL_VERSION is a layout format version (1, 2 later with another patch)
- DAOS_POOL_VERSION is a pool RPC protocol version (4 or 5)
- and in ds_pool_connect_handler() the handler_version is meant to refer to the RPC version (4 or 5 currently) but takes on the values 0 or 1.
LGTM

commits.message:
SRS-371 csum: Checksum Scrubbing Feature (#9345)

This is a single commit for the checksum scrubbing feature that was
developed on the feature/csum-scrubbing feature branch. It includes
the implementation and functional testing. The following tickets were
completed for this feature:

DAOS-5465: Corrupt BIO Address through VOS
Add the ability to set a bio address as corrupted using the VOS
iter API. This will be necessary for the checksum scrubber
to be able to mark data as corrupted when silent data
corruption is detected.

DAOS-6071: Introduced new pool and container properties as defined in
data_integrity.md

DAOS-6049: Checksum Scrubber Implementation: It iterates the vos
objects and for each data value, it will calculate a checksum and
compare it to the stored checksum. Added CORRUPTION_DETECTED to the
RAS_EVENT_LIST in preparation for raising RAS events. Introduced new
telemetry metrics. The scrubber is split between two files:
srv_pool_scrub_ult.c and vos_pool_scrub.c. The "ult" file is called
by the server to start the scrubber in its own persistent background
ult. The vos file does the actual scanning and scrubbing of the VOS
tree. Added a new test executable (srv_scrubbing_tests) which includes
unit tests for the vos scrubbing functionality.

DAOS-5467: Auto Evict Pool Target - When the checksum scrubber
detects enough silent data corruptions to exceed a threshold it will
initiate a drain on the pool target. Updated the migration system so
that if it detects a checksum error it will not fail the
migration/rebuild but will simply skip that object.

Testing introduced:

DAOS-8099: Enabling the scrubber in some basic tests and OSA tests

DAOS-9318: Target eviction test case

DAOS-8417 New functional tests for scrubber that read the scrubber
telemetry metrics and uses fault injection to verify that scrubbing
can be enabled and that data corruption is detected.

DAOS-7300: Target auto eviction

Signed-off-by: rpadma2 <ravindran.padmanabhan@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Ryon Jensen <ryon.jensen@intel.com>
Co-authored-by: Jeff Olivier <jeffrey.v.olivier@intel.com>

DAOS-10615 vos: Improvements to Standalone VOS (#9062)

If standalone VOS is using sys_db then it shouldn't delete the file
before creating or on exiting. Added function parameters so that
can indicate if using sys_db and also which target to use.
Previously for all standalone VOS instances always used -1 tgt id.
The daos debug tool will utilize the tgt id and will use the
sys_db smd file.

For initializing bio context, a target id of -1 was used to
indicate if it should self poll. However, to support the daos
debug tool, the actual target id is needed along with self polling.

Signed-off-by: Ryon Jensen <ryon.jensen@intel.com>

DAOS-9028 gc: Pre-allocate first GC bags (#8708)

When pools are too small, SCM space reserving is disabled. This
is problematic for tests that use tiny pools, fill them and then
try to delete a container. The gc bag isn't able to be allocated
for garbage collection. By pre-allocating the first bags this
issue can be worked around.

Signed-off-by: Ryon Jensen <ryon.jensen@intel.com>

DAOS-10196 vos: Allow pool open to ignore uuid (#8563)

In preparation for the daos debug tool, VOS needs to be able to open
a pool without knowing the pool uuid. Added the
VOS_POF_SKIP_UUID_CHECK flag to indicate if the pool uuid check
should be skipped.

Signed-off-by: Ryon Jensen <ryon.jensen@intel.com>

DAOS-9725 csum: Eliminate potential race condition for fetch (#8433)

During a vos_fetch_begin() the checksums are collected into an
array of csum_info structures. These structures pointed to the
checksums in SCM. However, after vos_fetch_begin() a call to
bio_iod_prep() can yield because of NVMe access. During the yield
the checksum the csum_info structures reference could change,
corrupting the csum. Instead of pointing to the checksum in SCM
we need to copy it into memory.

In order to manage the csum_infos and csum_buf in memory a new
structure and functions for better managing a list
of csum_infos is introduced. These functions and structure are
used during vos fetch.

Signed-off-by: Ryon Jensen <ryon.jensen@intel.com>

DAOS-10088 io: Fix memory escape (#8449)

If p_maps in ds_iom_create is NULL then the memory
allocated in the function will never be freed. Because
there is no reason to call ds_iom_create without p_maps,
changed the function to assert that p_maps was passed,
then can remove the conditional.

Signed-off-by: Ryon Jensen <ryon.jensen@intel.com>

DAOS-9804 csum: Checksum in VOS Tests and Aggregation Fix (#8225)

Added the ability to run VOS tests with checksums. The test, acting
as the client, is responsible for calculating the checksums on an
update and verifying the checksums on a fetch. While running the
VOS aggregation tests with checksums a few issues were discovered
and fixed.
- Previously, while inserting segments, the phy_ent's csum was
  updated to the truncated ent_int, however, it pointed to the
  ent_in's csum buffer instead of copying the checksum into its own
  buffer. Updated it to memcpy now. The phy_ent's csum buffer should
  always be big enough.
- In some cases, while adding checksums from raw extents for the
  requested extents, the holes weren't managed correctly and
  which could cause the incorrect checksum to be added for a
  chunk. This would result in a false positive checksum error.

Signed-off-by: Ryon Jensen <ryon.jensen@intel.com>

DAOS-11056 test: Check for rebuild status to complete. (#9624)

Presently, test fails to destroy the container/pool intermittently with DER_BUSY/DER_TIMEOUT status.
We need to make sure rebuild is not happening when we try to destroy container/pool. Once rebuild is done, pool/container destroy should work fine.

Signed-off-by: rpadma2 <ravindran.padmanabhan@intel.com>

DAOS-7326 test: Aggregation with multiple pools/containers. (#9351)

Add aggregation test to validate single pool/multiple containers, multiple pools/containers.

Signed-off-by: rpadma2 <ravindran.padmanabhan@intel.com>

DAOS-10607 test: Update the timeout/mask options. (#9253)

2. Increase timeout for osa offline reintegration/drain tests.

on borderline. Increasing the test timeout from 1200 to 1800 (to be on safe side).
