- Address IOR failures due to rf problem on offline drain tests.

Signed-off-by: rpadma2 <ravindran.padmanabhan@intel.com>

DAOS-9078 test: Fix sequential decrease in containers (#8424)

Test now calculates the total container difference the test should not deviate for each test loop. (eg: Assume mean containers created for each run is around 2500 containers. total container difference for each test loop = 2500 * (mean_percent [defined in yaml] / 100) = 13 containers.

Each test loop cannot exceed mean_container_count + percent deviation accepted. As shown in the above example, if mean_container_count is 2500, the percent deviation is 13. Which means total containers created for each loop can be in between 2513 and 2487.

Based on more investigation, we can still update the mean_percent value in the YAML to either high value or low value. For now, the value is 0.5 percent.

Signed-off-by: rpadma2 ravindran.padmanabhan@intel.com

DAOS-10058 test: Update default SCM format timeout (#8564)

We are noticing intermittent SCM format timeout issues
due to format taking more than 30 seconds. Increasing
it to 45 seconds.

DAOS-9744 test: Update the avocado tag with ib2 (#8547)

DAOS-10169 test: Add faults tag:test_pool_services, ec.py (#8548)

DAOS-9277 test: Add delay after reintegrating few targets. (#8228)

- Add a 15 sec delay while calling the print_and_assert_on_rebuild_failure(output, timeout=15)
- The delay is added while performing pool queries after reintegrating is complete. Pool queries can report -2031 errors till the redundacy factor code complete. The delay is inserted to avoid unwanted -2031 or -2001 errors as actual failures. The rebuild will recover from this state normally after 5 seconds.

DAOS-10300 test: fix dmg_pool_query (#9720)

DAOS-9820 test: simplify datamover test base (#8109)

Simplify the data mover test base to make it easier to add tests.

- Enhance and move `format_daos_path` to `duns_utils.format_path`
- New `set_dm_params` that takes a simplified set of params.
  - Deprecate `set_datamover_params`. Keep compatibility so all tests
    cases don't need to be updated immediately.
- Rename `self.parent` to `self.posix_root`
- Rename 'src_path' and 'dst_path' to 'src' and 'dst' for consistency

Signed-off-by: Dalton Bohning <dalton.bohning@intel.com>

DAOS-9947 test: Merge redundant ior small tests (#8274)

- Remove ior/hdf5
  - ior/small already has these variants
- ior/ior_small
  - Add DFUSE + IL variant
  - Use 32 client processes per client node
  - Add more feature tags
  - Use dual-engine
  - Misc cleanup

Signed-off-by: Dalton Bohning <dalton.bohning@intel.com>

DAOS-10129 test: add feature tags to ftest/datamover (#8467)

Tag datamover tests with more feature tags

Signed-off-by: Dalton Bohning <dalton.bohning@intel.com>

DAOS-9237 test: rework interception perf tests (#8112)

Rework interception performance tests to be more robust
  - Create ior_intercept_test_base.py for common test procedure
  - Run with 60s stonewall for 3 iterations
  - Only check "Max" value until we have a better handle on variance
  - Add human-readable description of performance difference
  - Update tags for interception tests

Signed-off-by: Dalton Bohning <dalton.bohning@intel.com>

DAOS-10033 test: remove ior/large and mdtest/large (#8362)

- They require more servers than are available in CI

- They have so many variations that even if we had enough servers, they
would take dozens to hundreds of hours to run

- Anyone needing to run these manually will realistically have to modify
  the config (or wait for hundreds of hours), so it makes more sense to
  just modify the ftest/*/small variants as needed

- Keeping them around incurs extra maintenance

Signed-off-by: Dalton Bohning <dalton.bohning@intel.com>

DAOS-623 review: add ftest-watchers to CODEOWNERS (#8364)


Signed-off-by: Dalton Bohning <dalton.bohning@intel.com>

DAOS-9946 test: update ftest/ior/crash.py (#8244)

- Rename ior/crash_ior to ior/crash
- Use 1 server, dual engine
- Use 3 clients
- Increase client processes per node
- Kill IOR in the middle of Read, not beginning
- General cleanup

Signed-off-by: Dalton Bohning <dalton.bohning@intel.com>

DAOS-9944 test: remove ftest/ior/intercept_dfuse_mix.py (#8241)

reviews.body: Clean cherry pick?

A test failure was introduced by #8689, and fixed by https://github.com/daos-stack/daos/commit/0e243044b00d7c6ceb14f1cc415b8ba11de21307. Since this PR needs a re-run anyway, please include this patch to avoid introducing a test failure into release/2.2.

Also, for changes like this, it's good to run with
```
Features: control dmg
```
LGTM, assuming tests pass
LGTM, just minor comments
LGMT. Minor comments
Should docs/usage be updated?
Is nothing using `DdbCommand` yet?
ftest changes look okay

Just realized the test tag is wrong. It should be `rebuild_widely_striped`, as `widelystriped` does not exist
https://github.com/daos-stack/daos/blob/bafa50a19f4ea0d2be74df963c8dac61c41cf862/src/tests/ftest/rebuild/widely_striped.py#L48

After to some previous changes, to set it for client side, the
default log level for engine has also become DLOG_ERR when it
would be preferred to set it as DLOG_INFO.

Due to "daos" Go-command binding, and the fact that Go do not
support C pre-processor macro, like the one defining the log
levels in src/include/gurt/dlog.h, an internal
daos_internal_debug_init() had to be defined.

A racy scenario exists when GC ULT his working on a

To avoid this, have GC ULT take an extra reference
on vos_container during the time it works on it.

DAOS-9671 nlt: use os.read() vs file.read() in cont_rw (#8634)

DAOS-9718 log: merged stderr should follow log switch (#7962)

The merging of stderr in log (DAOS-4522/PR-2450), and the log
switch based on size (DAOS-4233/PR-3405) features have been
developed separately and their full integration has been missed
causing merged stderr to not follow the log switch and thus to
continue filling <log>.old file, and thus have stderr msgs to
become desynchronized from log msgs.

DAOS-9217 pool/container: add rf pda pool and container properties (#7632)

Similarly to the EC cell size, we should have a default pool property for the
redundancy factor (RF) which is inherited to all containers (if not specify at
container creation time) in the pool. Default pool rf is 0.

Introduce another two new properties for pool and container as the user interfaces:

ec_pda=: Performance Domain Affinity Level of EC object.
rp_pda=: Performance Domain Affinity Level of replicated object.

The user can specify the PDA by setting these properties for either the pool or
the container or both: if the user specifies these properties only for a pool,
then all containers within this pool will inherit them from the pool; if the
user specifies them for both pool and container, then container properties will
the pool properties.

Default value of rp_pda is 3, the placement algorithm should place two-way and
three-way replication object within a PD; for those object classes with more
than 3 replicas, DAOS will place three replicas within a PD and switch to another PD.

Default value of EC_PDA is 1, the placement algorithm always tries to scatter
shards of EC object to different PDs.

Signed-off-by: Wang Shilong <shilong.wang@intel.com>

DAOS-1129 daos: rename rs_done to rs_state (#7885)

DRS_NOT_STARTED to indicate rebuild has not been started yet.

Re-declare DRS_COMPLETED and DRS_NOT_STARTED as non-zero, so
when old client access @rs_done, these state will be treated
as "true", this keep better compatibility than before.

Remove duplicated property.h, these functions are declared in

DAOS-10593 control: Fix NVMe available space (#9203)

The available space of NVMe devices was miscalculated: it was based on
the hypothesis that all NVMe devices of one engine were fairly shared by
its targets. At the end, one target can only manage one NVMe device. For
one engine, if the number of its targets is greater than the number of
NVMe devices, then some NVMe devices are fairly shared by two or more
targets.

Signed-off-by: Cedric Koch-Hofer <cedric.koch-hofer@intel.com>

DAOS-10146 build: ftest helper scripts (#8754)

Introduce Ansile scripts allowing to deploy a DAOS functional platform
over a WOLF's sub-cluster.  These ansible scripts also gnerates bash
scripts allowing to install DAOS binaries and run the functional tests.

Usage of these ansible scripts is detailled in the
utils/ansible/ftest/README.md file.

Signed-off-by: Cedric Koch-Hofer <cedric.koch-hofer@intel.com>

DAOS-10339 control: Fix pool creation drpc response (#8864)

Fix fields of the pool creation drpc reponse.  Some of these fields
were not filled by the engine: the control plane was using value from
the request which could be different from what was really done.

Features: control pool

Signed-off-by: Cedric Koch-Hofer <cedric.koch-hofer@intel.com>

DAOS-10225 control: fix available storage with heterogeneous NVMe (#8853)

When NVMe of different size are used by the same engine, then the
storage available for each device is equal to the one of the smallest
device.

Signed-off-by: Cedric Koch-Hofer <cedric.koch-hofer@intel.com>

DAOS-10251 test: Test ranks state with pool query (#8699)

Add tests checking the state of ranks (i.e. enabled or disabled) with the pool
query new features introduced with patches #8587 and #8659.
Update pool_query() helper function to handle the new options --show-enabled
and --show-disabled of the dmg cli sub-command pool query.

Signed-off-by: Cedric Koch-Hofer <cedric.koch-hofer@intel.com>

DAOS-10072 control: show all rank states of a pool (#8659)

Fix reviewers comments.

Signed-off-by: Cedric Koch-Hofer <cedric.koch-hofer@intel.com>

DAOS-10072 control: add ranks state to pool query (#8587)

Update dmg query command to show enabled or disabled ranks of a pool.
DRPC protocol has been updated to handle ranks set of enabled or disabled ranks.

Signed-off-by: Cedric Koch-Hofer <cedric.koch-hofer@intel.com>

DAOS-10176 test: fix create_all test timeout issue (#8592)

Increase the timeout and decrease the number of servers to reduce test
time duration variability.

Signed-off-by: Cedric Koch-Hofer <cedric.koch-hofer@intel.com>

DAOS-9558 control: Fix storage usage statistic (#8457)

Fix the storage usage statistic to return the size really available with
SCM and SMD tiers.  Also add some functional tests for the create pool
with full storage capacity.

Signed-off-by: Cedric Koch-Hofer <cedric.koch-hofer@intel.com>

DAOS-9906 cart: remove leftover build files (#8221)

Remove build files from when cart was a standalone repo.

Also fix files with inconsistent copyright style disabling pre-commit git hooks
and update pre-commit git hooks to support yaml and sh source files.

Signed-off-by: Cedric Koch-Hofer <cedric.koch-hofer@intel.com>

DAOS-10970 tests, ftest, object, dfuse: multiple coverity issues (#9593)

DAOS-10987: [coverity] 105878 Unchecked return value
DAOS-10997: [coverity] 105885 Unchecked return value
DAOS-10957: [coverity] 22009 Copy into fixed size buffer
DAOS-10963: [coverity] 105823, Unchecked return value
DAOS-11005: [coverity] 119294 Use of 32-bit time_t
DAOS-11003: [coverity] 119221 Use of 32-bit time_t
DAOS-10999: [coverity] 119034 Use of 32-bit time_t
DAOS-10959: [coverity] 22136 Copy into fixed size buffer
DAOS-10965: [coverity] 105825 Unchecked return value
DAOS-10966: [coverity] 105826 Unchecked return value
DAOS-10969: [coverity]: 105856 Unchecked return value

Signed-off-by: Lei Huang <lei.huang@intel.com>

DAOS-9201 dfs: Put back else removed accidentally (#9364)

One line else statement was removed accidentally in a previous PR.
Need to put it back.

Co-authored-by: Lei Huang <lei.huang@intel.com>

DAOS-10734 ftests: container.destroy() needs uuid parameter to test non-existing uuid (#9222)

daos_cont_destroy() in c still supports passing uuid, so container.destroy() needs uuid parameter to test non-existing uuid.

Signed-off-by: Lei Huang <lei.huang@intel.com>

DAOS-9201 API: Remove compatibility code for daos_cont_create() (#7834)

Only daos_cont_create() is used in c/c++ code. With a macro,
daos_cont_create2() is provided in API. daos_cont_create2() is
called in other languages.

Now daos_cont_create() will generate an uuid automatically.
user can NOT pass a given uuid to daos_cont_create(). Related .py
and .yaml in relevant test cases are revised.

Signed-off-by: Lei Huang <lei.huang@intel.com>

DAOS-10629 libfabric: upgrade to 1.15.1-1 (#9084)


Signed-off-by: Lei Huang <lei.huang@intel.com>
Co-authored-by: Ray Dennis <raydennis@outlook.com>

DAOS-9200 obj: remove compatibility code for daos_obj_generate_oid (#7733)

daos_obj_generate_oid() is removed. Only daos_obj_generate_oid2 is
supported in API. daos_obj_generate_oid() is used in all other
places. Type daos_ofeat_t is removed. Only enum daos_otype_t is
used.

1. Re-arrange macro daos_obj_generate_oid. Only daos_obj_generate_oid()
is supported in c/c++ code. daos_obj_generate_oid2() is provided in
libdaos.so due to the macro. daos_obj_generate_oid2() should be used in
non-c/c++ languages (go and python, etc).

2. enum constants DAOS_OF_* are removed. DAOS_OT_* are used in stead.

Signed-off-by: Lei Huang <lei.huang@intel.com>

DAOS-10071 utils: add ranks state to pool query (#8924)

Add ranks state to "daos pool query".
  "--show-enabled" shows enabled ranks.
  "--show-disabled" shows disabled ranks.

Signed-off-by: Lei Huang <lei.huang@intel.com>

DAOS-9826 datamover: truncate files that exist in daos fs copy. (#8837)

Add O_TRUNC flag in fs_copy_file().

Signed-off-by: Lei Huang <lei.huang@intel.com>

DAOS-9883 libfabric: Update to v1.15.0rc3-1 (#8776)


Signed-off-by: Lei Huang <wiliam_huang@hotmail.com>

DAOS-10076 API: Macros are needed for middleware compatibility (#8425)

We need macros to enforce middleware call daos_pool_connect2(),
daos_cont_open2(), and daos_cont_destroy2().

Signed-off-by: Lei Huang <wiliam_huang@hotmail.com>

DAOS-10922 control: Implement ipmctl stubs for non-amd64 platforms (#9505)

Implement NvmMgmt and IpmCtl interface for platforms that don't support ipmctl.

Signed-off-by: Chunsong Feng <fengchunsong@huawei.com>

DAOS-11030 mpi: fix build error when the mpi is not installed (#9560)

without mpi install, the base_env_mpi is null, compile error:
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'AppendUnique'
In addition, there is base_env_mpi.AppendUnique(LIBPATH=[Dir('.') at
line 33.

Signed-off-by: Chunsong Feng <fengchunsong@huawei.com>

DAOS-10891 tests: fix incorrect assert in check_oclass (#9456)

If the domain_nr is bigger then 18, it will do two assert. The first
assert_int_equal(attr->u.ec.e_k, 16) is passed, and fail at the second
assert_int_equal(attr->u.ec.e_k, 8). Mondify to do only one assert.

Signed-off-by: Chunsong Feng <fengchunsong@huawei.com>

DAOS-10899 test: use expected variable to do assert checking (#9487)

The test case expecte to check with arg->co_info.ci_lsnapshot.

Signed-off-by: Chunsong Feng <fengchunsong@huawei.com>

DAOS-10898 obj: fix the assert in small_io test (#9486)

daos_array_read with type=DAOS_OT_ARRAY, the array->byte_array is false,
then it don't invoke tse_task_register_cbs to register check_short_read_cb,
so use typeb to test small_io.

Signed-off-by: Chunsong Feng <fengchunsong@huawei.com>

DAOS-10872 control: Fix aarch64 build control errors (#9401)

go:build support both amd64 and arm64.
Dup2 function is added to support both amd64 and arm64.
syscall.Dup2 does not exist on arm64, therefore, Dup2 function is added
to be compatibale with multiple archs.

Signed-off-by: Chunsong Feng <fengchunsong@huawei.com>

DAOS-10871 build: Fix aarch64 build SPDK error (#9398)

When build the dependent component SPDK in aarch64 platform, an error is
reported because the incorrect march=haswell. When is ARM platform, set
march to native.

Signed-off-by: Chunsong Feng <fengchunsong@huawei.com>

commits.message:
DAOS-10736 Cart: Add support for UCX tcp transport (#9615)

Signed-off-by: Jerome Soumagne <jerome.soumagne@intel.com>

DAOS-11002 Cart: fix dereference of NULL return value in crt test (#9616)

Fix null deref in tests

Signed-off-by: Jerome Soumagne <jerome.soumagne@intel.com>

DAOS-10828 mercury: Update to mercury 2.2.0rc6 (#9329)

*Switch UCX to use active messages and fix UCX issues with hostname parsing / address key not set
*Enable CXI and OPX as supported plugins
*Fix ctrl-c issue that was happening in DAOS when interrupting a bulk transfer that required usage of overflow mechanism
*Update Cart to use new CXI init string
*Remove dependency on mercury_util and use HG_Set_log routines
*Remove rpath fix as mercury now automatically adds rpath info
*Additional fixes and new features: Full notes: https://github.com/mercury-*hpc/mercury/blob/v2.2.0rc6/Documentation/CHANGES.md

Signed-off-by: Jerome Soumagne <jerome.soumagne@intel.com>

DAOS-10849 build: fix ALT_PREFIX build (#9369

Signed-off-by: Jerome Soumagne <jerome.soumagne@intel.com>

DAOS-5719 compression: Add SVM support for QAT compression (#9283)

* Add SVM(Shared Virtual Memory) support for QAT compression
  If SVM is enabled, allocating physical contiguous memory and
  copying data between physical and virtual memory is not needed
  which can greatly reduce the memory copy cost.
* Fix the issue of repeatedly starting and stopping QAT devices
  under multi-thread mode.

Signed-off-by: Chengfei Zhu <chengfei.zhu@intel.com>

DAOS-9929 test: Test updated for DAOS-9929, increase clush timeout. (#8356)

Increase timeout for clush commands run in functional tests on VM hosts.

Signed-off-by: Kurniawan Alfizah <kurniawan.alfizah@intel.com>

DAOS-623 doc: add tensorflow documentation (#8517)

Adds tensorflow docs.

Signed-off-by: Omar Marzouk <omar.marzouk.ext@brightskiesinc.com>

DAOS-8103 pydaos: uses shared event queue  (#9552)

Use a shared event queue to submit I/O instead of one per python call.

Signed-off-by: Sherin T George <sherin-t.george@hpe.com>
